ERRM, ERRM General
35.1 ERRM General
� General Information
Target / Objectives of ERRM function
This aggregate speci?cation contains the requirements for an error management function that complies with
all the relevant legislative regulations for all target markets.
The main goals of error management aggregate (ERRM) is to:
? Collect, store and provide diagnostics information for repair and inspection programs.
? Inform the driver via dashboard lamps from malfunctions which could affect emissions compliance with
regulations.
? Collect diagnostics performances and frequency (e.g. rate based monitoring, readiness status in PID $01,
completion status in PID $41).
? Store and format data before exporting to external tester (Mode $06 test results, Mode $02 freeze
frames, environmental data) and to further control units.
? Ensure limp home coordination with help of Fault Reaction manager (FARM)
? A central interface between error management and external testers is also provided that collects all data
relevant (Mode $01 to $0A) for generic scan tool (GST). Data for other external tester (service, production,
...) may be speci?ed OEM speci?cally.
Architecture Overview
Principle of the dynamic error management is to receive diagnoses results (?ltered or not by anti-bounce,
muliti-condition, or statistical algorithms). These results are managed as diagnoses failures, according CARB
and EOBD standards.

ERRM, ERRM General
Figure 35.1.1: ERRM architecture overview
Description of the containing functions
? Universal Diagnostic Interface
This module manages all the diagnostic algorithms and initializations. It creates automatically by con?guration
all the needed data and calibration per diagnostic and per class. Several classes are available like : ABC_8,
ABC_16, STC, NO_FIL. For each diagnostic initialization is calibratable and could be prede?ned in the project
con?guration.
? Diagnostic legacy interface
This module contains all legacy interfaces needed to maintain compatibility between old diagnostics from
ERRM 4.x.x and UDGI module. A symptom splitter allows to split failures by symptoms in order to create
symptom based diagnostics.
? Diagnostics ?lter algorithms
This module is in charge of fault ?ltering according prede?ned ?lters.
? Dynamic Error Management core

ERRM, ERRM General
The dynamic error management core manages different failures states thanks to the fault detection performed
by the diagnoses : detected, present, temporary, pending, disappeared and con?rmed. All failures are
detected without any limitation on quantity. On the contrary, the number of present failures able to be
stored into dynamic memory is limited. Management of this limitation is performed thanks to priority rules
mechanism.
When a failure is stored into dynamic memory, the related environment data is stored, the lamp man-
agement may force lamp illumination (MIL, WAL,...), and DTCs management is done until failure is deleted.
When deleted, failures are stored into history memory.
? History memory
History memory permits to trace historic of deleted failures. Some speci?c information are stored for each
deleted failure. Only the more pertinent data linked to failure shall be stored.
? Cycle manager
Cycle manager computes driving cycle and warm-up cycle according to engine states and engine coolant
temperature. Cycle manager permits to evaluate failure states.
? Failures class
Each failure can be con?gured to obtain a speci?c behaviour : emission relevant or not, can illuminate MIL or
not ... This module contain to all the prede?ned behaviours each failure can be associated with. It permits
to simplify greatly tuning of diagnosis by decreasing quantity of calibrations.
? DTC management
DTC management permits to catch some data when a failure becomes present and to generate a code iden-
ti?er, called DTC. It permits to identify default of the function.
? Communication interface
This module is dedicated to EOBD communication.
This module allow to access failure memory data related to error management such as freeze frame, stored
DTCs, readiness codes.
? UDS communication interface
This module is dedicated to UDS communication and interface with DGNC aggregate for services $14, $19 and
$85.
? Priority rules
This module manages dynamic memory size limitation. It de?nes criteria, called priority rules, to store or not a
new failure into this dynamic memory.
? Environmental data
This module describes the structure of the freeze frame and its management : storage and delete.

ERRM, ERRM General
? Similar conditions
Similar conditions are additional conditions based on engine and load status to erase a failure in memory (for
Mis?re and Fuel system failure only).
? Lamp management
Lamp management module can manage illumination of several warning lamps ( MIL and other warning lamps
) including pre-drive check.
? Readiness codes
Readiness codes allow to know if a diagnosis has been performed or not.
? Rate-based monitoring
This module evaluates and report monitoring performances under real world conditions.
? Statistical data
Statistical data allows monitoring and storage of statistical data on error management data ?ow.
? Permanent fault code
This module manages the permanent fault codes into a new dedicated dynamic memory.
? Failure dating
This module provide additional failure information : system time at failure occurrence, driving cycle number
?ow at failure occurrence.
? NOx fault management
This module manage NOx faults with Heavy duty applications and enables or disables the torque limiter.

0 ...3

6 [-]
0x6
Con?guration for pre-drive check strategy in case of
engine stalling, short key transition while engine is
running and readiness status displaying
activation/deactivation.
Range: 00 ... 07H
Bit 0 = 0 : pre-drive check between stalling event
and engine start is disabled
Bit 0 = 1 : pre-drive check between stalling event and
engine start is enabled
Bit 1 = 0 : short pre-drive check disabled in case of
key transition while engine is running
Bit 1 = 1 : short pre-drive check enabled in case of
key transition while engine is running
Bit 2 = 0 : readiness status displaying during
pre-drive check (MIL blinking) is disabled
Bit 2 = 1 : readiness status displaying during
pre-drive check (MIL blinking) is enabled
Typical value : 100b

35.2.3 Other con?gurations data derived from other ERRM modules
The following con?gurations data are enumerated here but con?gured in other modules, in order to avoid
double con?gurations work by projects.
Table of failure
NC_NR_WIN_SCDN is directly derived from the Table of Failure module.
It is the number of diagnoses using similar conditions calculation. Its range belongs to [0...32].
The project speci?c value is con?gured into the Table of Failure module.
NC_IDX_INST_SCDN[NC_NR_WIN_SCDN] is the table of different failure instances using Similar conditions func-
tionality.
NC_NR_FID_AVL_RBM is the number of FARM indexes available per RBM index,
Environmental data (Appl. Inc.)
NC_NR_ENVD_OBD is the number of different environment data (in bytes) which are stored in OBD freeze
frame. It is de?ned between 0 and 255. The project speci?c value is con?gured into the Environmental data
(Appl. Inc.) module.
NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_CMN is the number of different environment data (in bytes) which are stored in CUS_CMN
freeze frame. It is de?ned between 0 and 255.

� General Information
This ?le lists all the diagnostics which are connected to ERRM.
In addition, it de?nes other connections with several functions provided by ERRM:
- Rate Based Monitoring
- Similar Condition functionality
- Pre-stored Freeze Frame
The purpose of this paragraph is to establish the whole list of failures managed by ERRM aggregate.
Around diagnostics,

ERRM, Table of failures
The table of failures provides the list of diagnostics with NC_IDX_ERR_XX as identi?er.
For each diagnostic, several information are provided (as mandatory or optional):
? The diagnostic instance: XX,
? The diagnostic class,
? The diagnostic initialization type,
? The name of the action to clear the symptom or restart the symptom calculation,
? The name of the action to get internal diagnostic information.
? The CARB readiness class (in case of con?gurable usage),
ACTION_<AGGR>_ResetDiag<ObdSymName>(IN <PRM_STATE_INI >, IN <PRM_NR_CONF>)
This action must be exported by the diagnostic and it is called by ERRM :
- to erase the diagnostic failure
- to force diagnostic to restart when a new driving cycle is detected
ACTION_<AGGR>_GetSdr<ObdSymName>(OUT<PRM_STATE_DIAG>, OUT<PRM_ABC>, OUT<PRM_ABC_
INC>, OUT<PRM_ABC_DEC>, OUT<PRM_ABC_MAX>, IN<PRM_NR_CONF>)
This action must be exported by the diagnostic. It may be called by other functions (After Sales, UDS Commu-
nication,...) to get internal diagnostic data.
Around diagnostics connection to rate-based monitoring (i.e. RBM, IUPR),
In addition, the table of failures provides the list diagnostics tracked by rate-based monitoring function, with
NC_IDX_RBM_XX as identi?er inside NC_IDX_DIAG_RBM[NC_NR_DIAG_RBM].
This table is splitted in two parts:
? Symptom based diagnostics without Rate-Based Monitoring interface
with index = 1 ... NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM,
Managed by the centralized module de?ned inside ?RBM (Appl. Inc.)? speci?cation.
? Symptom based diagnostics with Rate-Based Monitoring interface
with index = (NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM + 1) ... NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
At ?nal, NC_NR_DIAG_RBM = NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM + NC_NR_DIAG_INT_RBM.
Around FARM inhibition indexes,
Number of FARM indexes available per central RBM index (standard = 1, enhanced = 2)
NC_NR_FID_AVL_RBM is automatically computed by SW tooling based on the content of the table of failure.

� General Information
The ?ltering algorithm (anti-bounce or statistic) is used for simple diagnosis (e.g.: OBD1 diagnosis). If the al-
gorithm is not applicable, the diagnosis manages itself the computation of the result parameter "PASS", "FAIL",
"INTM" or "NO_EVE".
The ?ltering is used to ?lter the detected failure. The failure becomes present after ?ltering.

** 
Case of PRM_ABC_DEC > PRM_ABC_INC 
In case of no failure the delay to get the event pass is the same than the delay to get a fail when there is a
failure.
To have this functionality, the increment calibration is used as decrement, when the counter is negative.
To avoid an ?overshooting? in the case PRM_ABC_DEC>PRM_ABC_INC, the resulting ABC is limited to - PRM_
ABC_INC when the counter starts decrementing from a positive value.

For each diagnostic managed by UDGI a calibratable logical ?eld is available :
C_ABC_INI_TYP [NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR] is ?ll in according ToF
bit 0: No init at Reset typical value 0 : init on Reset
bit 1: No init at Key Transition typical value 0 : init on IGK
bit 2: No init on DC typical value 0 : init on DC (1 ini only if |ABC|=MAX)
bit 3: Fast restart (MEM_INI) typical value 0 : not fast restart
bit 4: Failure frozen until key Off (MEM) typical value 0 : no freeze on failure
bit 5: Reset ABC if lost CDN typical value 0 : no reset on lost condition
bit 6: External initialization behaviour during RST/KEY_ON enabled : typical value 0 (1:allowed, 0:locked)
bit 7: Failure locked no ERRM input typical value 0 : failure not frozen
Precon?g: STD_INI=0h, STD=3h, MEM=14h, MEM_INI=1Ch, STC=3h, NO_INI=3h, MPL_STD_INI=0h,
STD_INI_DC_MAX=4h (special case for diagnostics activated in the same time as engine starts)
The indexes are managed as described below:

� Application Conditions
Initialisation:
At Power On (SYS_EVE_RST) :
For i = 0 to NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR-1
LV_CDN_DIAG[i] = 0
LV_SYM[i] = 0
EndFor
Call ACTION_ERRM_InitUdgi(?RST?)
At IGK_ON (SYS_EVE_IGKON) :
Set LV_ERR_INH_CLR_IGK = 1 at the begining of
the ASW SYS_EVE_IGKON task
Call ACTION_ERRM_InitUdgi(?IGKON?)
Set LV_ERR_INH_CLR_IGK = 0 at the end of
the ASWSYS_EVE_IGKON task
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Recurrence: -

35.5.2 Temporary Inhibition of Power Stage Diagnostics
� General Information
Delay to allow temporary inhibition of power stage diagnostics after reset.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event
DLY_ACT_DIAG_ACR = C_DLY_ACT_DIAG_ACR
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 10ms
� Function Description
If LV_CDN_VB_OBD1 = 1
Then If DLY_ACT_DIAG_ACR > 0 s
Then DLY_ACT_DIAG_ACR = DLY_ACT_DIAG_ACR - 10 ms
EndIf
Else DLY_ACT_DIAG_ACR = C_DLY_ACT_DIAG_ACR
EndIf

jj = jj + 1
EndFor

//Counters frc[] and tcc[] are not saved data and therefore //init
with 0 at ECU power-up every time (regardless of calib //value):
// frc[] <- - 0
// tcc[] <- - 0
// Remove Error from ERRM
ACTION_ERRM_ResetInternal(IN<jj>)
EndIf(1)
If(2)
bit 1 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[jj]=0 and PRM_STATE_EVE=?IGKON?
Then(2)
// Init Filter done anyway at reset event (not saved data)
TCC[i] = 0
FRC[i] = 0
// Remove Error from ERRM
ACTION_ERRM_ResetInternal(IN<jj>)
EndIf(2)
jj = jj + 1
EndFor
// MPL class
For i = 0 to NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR_MPL - 1
// Init according configuration
// Reset ERRM failure according diagnostic calibration
If(1a) bit 0 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[jj]=0 and PRM_STATE_EVE=?RST?
Then(1a)
// Init both filtering: only at reset
ABC_MPL_PREL[i] = 0
ABC_MPL[i] = 0
// Remove Error from ERRM
ACTION_ERRM_ResetInternal(IN<jj>)
EndIf(1a)
If(1b) bit 1 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[jj]=0 and PRM_STATE_EVE=?IGKON?
Then(1b)
// Init second Filter
ABC_MPL[i] = 0
// Remove Error from ERRM
ACTION_ERRM_ResetInternal(IN<jj>)
EndIf(1b)
jj = jj + 1
EndFor
// NO_FIL class
For i = 0 to NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR_NO_FIL - 1
// Init according configuration
// Reset ERRM failure according diagnostic calibration
If(1) (bit 0 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[jj]=0 and PRM_STATE_EVE=?RST?)
or
(bit 1 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[jj]=0 and PRM_STATE_EVE=?IGKON?)
Then(1)
// Remove Error from ERRM
ACTION_ERRM_ResetInternal(IN<jj>)
EndIf(1)
jj = jj + 1

// If diagnostic is managed by variant coding or locked
If LV_ERR_DIAG_VAR_COD[i] = 1 or bit 7 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[i] = 1
Then
// Force diagnostic PASS
ACTION_ERRM_RecordInternal(IN<i>, IN<?PASS?>)
EndIf

// FARM management
If PRM_STATE_EVE=?IGKON?
Then
// Init on key transition is notified to FARM
ACTION_FARM_ReqInit()

ERRM, Universal diagnostic interface
General information:
This function computes the UDGI filter data initialisation in case of IGKON &
RST for ABC_8, ABC_CONF, ABC_CAL, MPL filter class according the calibration
C_ABC_INI_TYP.
Formula section:
If(1) [bit 0 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR]=0 and PRM_STATE_EVE=?RST?]
or
[bit 1 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR]=0 and PRM_STATE_EVE=?IGKON?]
Then(1)
If(2) bit 3 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0 // not MEM_INI
Then(2)
PRM_ABC = 0
Else(2)
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>, OUT<PRM_LV_ERR>)
If(3)PRM_LV_ERR = 1
Then(3)
PRM_ABC=PRM_ABC_MAX - PRM_ABC_INC
Else(3)
PRM ABC = 0
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
ACTION_ERRM_ResetInternal(PRM_IDX_ERR)
Else(1)
// No init requested
// Simulate saving in NVMY (executed only at reset)
If(3) PRM_STATE_EVE=?RST?
Then(3)
If(4) ACTION_ERRM_GetEndDiag(PRM_IDX_ERR) = 1
Then(4)
If(5) ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(PRM_IDX_ERR) = 1
Then(5)
PRM_ABC = PRM_ABC_MAX
Else(5)
PRM_ABC = -PRM_ABC_MAX
Endif(5)
Else(4)
PRM ABC = 0
Endif(4)
Endif(3)
Endif(1)

ERRM, Universal diagnostic interface
General information:
This module delivers the result to ERRM only in case of the failure will change
state, the transition LV_ERR 1 to 0 is not possible if the diagnostic has been
fail since Key On and the configuration MEM has been chosen.
Details for MEM filtering:
lv_end = 1 and lv_err_rec = 1 and MEM - don?t call pass
lv_end = 1 and lv_err_rec = 1 and no MEM - call pass
lv_end = 1 and lv_err_rec = 0 and MEM / no_MEM - don?t no call pass
lv_end = 0 and lv_err_rec = 0/1 and MEM / no_MEM - call pass
Formula section:
If(1) PRM_STATE_FIL = ?NO_EVE?
Then(1)
// do nothing
Else(1)
If(2) PRM_STATE_FIL = ?PASS?
Then(2)
ACTION_ERRM_GetEndDiag(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <OUT>PRM_LV_END)
ACTION_ERRM_GetErrRec(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR>, <OUT>PRM_LV_ERR_REC)
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR>,<OUT>PRM_LV_ERR)
If(3) [PRM_LV_END = 0
Or
(bit 4 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR]= 0
And PRM_LV_ERR_REC = 1)
Or
(bit 4 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR]= 1
And PRM_LV_ERR = 0)]
Then(3)
// Failure removed
ACTION_ERRM_RecordInternal(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <IN>?PASS?)
Endif(3)
LV_DIAG_LOCK_PASS[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
Else(2)
If(4) PRM_STATE_FIL = ?FAIL?
Then(4)
ACTION_ERRM_GetEndDiag (<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <OUT>PRM_LV_END)
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR>, <OUT>PRM_LV_ERR)
If(5)PRM_LV_END = 0
or PRM_LV_ERR = 0
Then(5)
// Failure detected
ACTION_ERRM_RecordInternal(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR>, <IN>?FAIL?)
EndIf(5)
LV_DIAG_LOCK_FAIL[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
Else(4)
If(6) PRM_STATE_FIL = ?INTM?
Then(6)
#if (NC_NR_ERR_INTM > 0)
ACTION_ERRM_RecordInternal(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR,
<IN>?INTM?)
#else
// Intermittent failures strategy is disabled
#endif
Else(6)
// INC, DEC or invalid value: do nothing
EndIf(6)
EndIf(4)
Endif(2)
Endif(1)

ACTION_ERRM_InitDcDgoAbc(IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>, IN<PRM_ABC_INC>, IN<PRM_ABC_MAX>,
INOUT<PRM_ABC>)
Action to init DGO
Parameter Type Hex. Limits Phys. limits Resol. Unit
PRM_IDX_ERR IN 0H...FFFFH 0...65535 1 -
Diagnostic index
PRM_ABC_INC IN 0H...7FH 0...127 1 -
Diagnostic max

Diagnostic max
PRM_ABC INOUT 80...FFH -128...127 1 -
Diagnostic counter
General information:
This function computes the UDGI filter data initialisation in case of new DC
for ABC, ABC_CONF, ABC_CAL filter classes according the calibration C_ABC_INI_
TYP.
Formula section:
If(1) bit 2 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0 // Init on DC
Then(1)
If(2) bit 3 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0 // not MEM_INI
Then(2)
PRM_ABC = 0
Else(2)
ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <OUT>PRM_LV_ERR)
If(3)PRM_LV_ERR = 1
Then(3)
PRM_ABC= PRM_ABC_MAX - PRM_ABC_INC
Else(3)
PRM ABC= 0
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Else(1)
// Init only if |ABC| <> MAX
// Used for diagnostic that start when engine speed <>0 (Cf ENSD)
If(2) |PRM ABC| = PRM_ABC_MAX
Then(2)
PRM_ABC = 0
Else(2)
// No init requested
EndIf(2)
Endif(1)

NO_EVE

1 -
Diagnostic state
General information:
PRM_STATE_DGO definition
Bit 0 (CDN): Diagnostic condition
Bit 1 (SYM): Diagnostic symptom
Bit 2 (NO_VLD): Diagnostic result not valid
Bit 3 (PREV_FIL): Pre-filtering init request
Bit 4 (ABC_END_REST): End of diagnostic restart
Formula section:
If(1) PRM_IDX_ERR < NC_IDX_ERR_FIRST_ABC_REC
Then(1)
// Test if diagnostic is not disabled by variant coding and not locked
If(2) LV_ERR_DIAG_VAR_COD[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
and bit 7 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
Then(2)
If(2a) bit 0 (CDN) of PRM_STATE_DGO = 1
Then(2a)
// Diagnostic is in condition
LV_CDN_DIAG(PRM_IDX_ERR) = 1
PRM_LV_SYM = bit 1 (SYM) of PRM_STATE_DGO
// Get old diagnostic status
// (for later FARM triggering in case of change)
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <OUT>PRM_STATE_OLD)
// Management of restart of end of diagnostic counter
TMP_CLAS_DGO = NC_ABC_CLAS[PRM_IDX_ERR]
If(2b) bit 4 (ABC_REST) of PRM_STATE_DGO = 1
Then(2b)
ACTION_ERRM_RestartUdgiAbc(PRM_IDX_ERR, TMP_CLAS_DGO)
EndIf(2b)
If(2c) [(PRM_LV_SYM = 0
And LV_DIAG_LOCK_PASS [PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1)
Or
(PRM_LV_SYM = 1
And LV_DIAG_LOCK_FAIL [PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1)]
And
bit 2 (NO_VAL) of PRM_STATE_DGO = 0
Then(2c)
//CPU optimization active and diagnostic result valid
PRM_STATE_FIL = "NO_EVE"
Else(2c)
//Normal treatment or diagnostic result not valid
File: 7EA0RS02.00A
9550Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
ERRM, Universal diagnostic interface
// locking mechanism is removed
LV_DIAG_LOCK_PASS(PRM_IDX_ERR) = 0
LV_DIAG_LOCK_FAIL(PRM_IDX_ERR) = 0
PRM_STATE_FIL = "NO_EVE"
//Filtering
ACTION_ERRM_ClcFilterDiagUdgi(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR,
<IN>PRM_STATE_DGO, <IN>TMP_CLAS_DGO, <OUT>PRM_STATE_FIL)
// Record result to dynamic layer
ACTION_ERRM_StoreErrm(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <IN>PRM_STATE_FIL>)
EndIf(2c)
// Check if symptom has changed
If(2e) LV_SYM[PRM_IDX_ERR] <> PRM_LV_SYM
Then(2e)
// The symptom is updated
LV_SYM[PRM_IDX_ERR] = PRM_LV_SYM
EndIf(2e)
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <OUT>PRM_STATE_NEW)
If(2f) PRM_STATE_FIL_OLD <> PRM_STATE_FIL_NEW
Then(2f)
// Trig FARM
ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnEvent(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR,
<IN>PRM_STATE_FIL_OLD, <IN>PRM_STATE_FIL_NEW)
EndIf(2f)
Else(2a)
// Diagnostic is not in condition
PRM_STATE_FIL = "NO_EVE"
LV_CDN_DIAG[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
// locking mechanism is removed
LV_DIAG_LOCK_PASS[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
LV_DIAG_LOCK_FAIL[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
If(2g) bit 5 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR]
Then(2g)
ACTION_ERRM_RestartUdgiAbc(PRM_IDX_ERR,
NC_ABC_CLAS[PRM_IDX_ERR])
Else(2g)
// No action requested when diagnostic not in condition
EndIf(2g)
EndIf(2a)
Else(2)
// Diagnostic deactivated by variant coding or locked :
// return NO_EVE
PRM_STATE_FIL = "NO_EVE"
EndIf(2)
Else(1)
//Invalid index
PRM_STATE_FIL = "NO_EVE"
EndIf(1)

35.5.28 ACTION_ERRM_VarCod
ACTION_ERRM_VarCod(IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>, IN<PRM_LV_ERR_DEAC>)
Action to activate/desactivate diagnostic
Parameter Type Hex. Limits Phys. limits Resol. Unit
PRM_IDX_ERR IN 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Failure Index
PRM_LV_ERR_DEAC IN 0... 1H 0... 1 1 -
Parameter to deactivate diagnostic by variant coding (0 : diagnostic is activated)
Formula section:
If PRM_IDX_ERR < NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR
Then
If LV_ERR_DIAG_VAR_COD[PRM_IDX_ERR] <> PRM_LV_ERR_DEAC
Then
// Variant coding is activated or deactivated
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_STATUS_OLD)
LV_ERR_DIAG_VAR_COD[PRM_IDX_ERR]=PRM_LV_ERR_DEAC
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_STATUS_NEW)
If PRM_STATUS_OLD <> PRM_STATUS_NEW
Then
ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnEvent(PRM_IDX_ERR,PRM_STATE_OLD,
PRM_STATUS_NEW)
Endif
ACTION_ERRM_InitErrmDataByErr(PRM_IDX_ERR)
// FARM is already called internally to InitErrmDataByErr
Endif
Else
// Invalid diagnostic index: do nothing
EndIf

35.5.30 ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus
ACTION_ERRM_GetErrmStatus (IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>, OUT<PRM_STATE_ERR_16>)
Action to get all diagnostic data
Parameter Type Hex.Limits Phys.Limits Resol. Unit
PRM_IDX_ERR IN 0...FFFFH 0...65535 1 [-]
Identifier of the diagnostic instance
PRM_STATE_ERR_16 OUT 0...FFFFH 0...65535 1 [-]
Diagnostic state
General information:
This ACTION returns the following bit :
Bit 0 == > LV_ERR (Failure state)
Bit 1 == > LV_ERR_REC (Last diag result recorded by ERRM)
Bit 2 == > LV_ERR_LST_IGK (Diag fail since Key Off to On)
Bit 3 == > LV_ERR_PND_STAT (Pending status)
Bit 4 == > LV_SYM (Symptom)
Bit 5 == > LV_END_DIAG (Diag done since start DC)
Bit 6 == > LV_READY (Readiness)
Bit 7 == > LV_MIL_RLV (Mil relevant)
Bit 8 ==> LV_ERR_PREL (Last diag result provided by DIAG)
Bit 9 ==> LV_ERR_MEM (Diag fail since start DC)
Bit 10,15 ==> not used
Formula section :
PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = 0
Bit 0 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_ERR[PRM_IDX_ERR]
Bit 1 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_ERR_REC[PRM_IDX_ERR]
Bit 2 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_ERR_LST_IGK[PRM_IDX_ERR]
Bit 3 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_ERR_PND_STAT[PRM_IDX_ERR]
Bit 4 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_SYM[PRM_IDX_ERR]
Bit 5 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_END_DIAG[PRM_IDX_ERR]
Bit 6 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_READY[PRM_IDX_ERR]
ACTION_ERRM_GetMilRelevant(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_LV_MIL_RLV)
Bit 7 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = PRM_LV_MIL_RLV
Bit 8 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_ERR_PREL[PRM_IDX_ERR]
Bit 9 of PRM_STATE_ERR_16 = LV_ERR_MEM[PRM_IDX_ERR]

// This interface is called by other diagnostic interfaces, e.g. by ACTION_
ERRM_NoFilterSymptom, so it?s not possible to restrict treatment only for indexes
in class ABC_REC.
If(0) (PRM_IDX_ERR >= NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR)
Then(0)
// Invalid diagnostic index
Else(0)
If(1) bit 6 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
or (LV_RST_END = 1 and LV_ERR_INH_CLR_IGK = 0 )
// Authorized at each system event
Then(1)
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>, OUT<TMP_OLD_STATUS>)
ACTION_ERRM_ResetInternal(IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>)
// LV_ERR is cleared
ACTION_ERRM_ClearDiagUdgiByErr(PRM_IDX_ERR)
// Clears ABC
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>, OUT<TMP_NEW_STATUS>)
If(2) (TMP_OLD_STATUS != TMP_NEW_STATUS)
Then(2)
ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnEvent(IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>, IN<TMP_OLD_STATUS>,
IN<TMP_NEW_STATUS>)
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
EndIf(0)

Formula section:
If(0) (PRM_IDX_ERR < NC_IDX_ERR_FIRST_ABC_REC)
Or (PRM_IDX_ERR >= NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR)
Then(0)
// Invalid diagnostic index
Else(0)
PRM_STATE_DGO = 0
If(1a) PRM_STATE_FIL=?PASS?
Then(1a)
PRM_STATE_DGO=1 //Diag pass
EndIf(1a)
If(1b) PRM_STATE_FIL=?FAIL?
Then(1b)
PRM_STATE_DGO=3 //Diag failure
EndIf(1b)
If(1c) PRM_STATE_FIL=?INTM? or PRM_STATE_FIL=?INC?
Then(1c)
PRM_STATE_DGO=7 //sym detected but result not available
EndIf(1c)
If(1d) PRM_STATE_FIL=?DEC?
Then(1d)
PRM_STATE_DGO=5 //sym not detected but result not available
EndIf(1d)
// Test if diagnostic is not disabled by variant coding and by locking
If(2) LV_ERR_DIAG_VAR_COD[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
and
bit 7 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
Then(2)
If(2a) bit 0 (CDN) of PRM_STATE_DGO = 1
Then(2a)
// Diagnostic is in condition
LV_CDN_DIAG[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
PRM_LV_SYM = bit 1 (SYM) of PRM_STATE_DGO
// Get old diagnostic status
// (for later FARM triggering in case of change)
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <OUT>PRM_STATE_OLD)
// record result to dynamic layer
ACTION_ERRM_StoreErrm(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <IN>PRM_STATE_FIL>)
// Check if symptom has changed
If(2e) LV_SYM[PRM_IDX_ERR] <> PRM_LV_SYM
Then(2e)
// The symptom is updated
LV_SYM[PRM_IDX_ERR] = PRM_LV_SYM
EndIf(2e)
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <OUT>PRM_STATE_NEW)
File: 7EA0RS02.00A
9567Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
ERRM, Universal diagnostic interface
If(2f) PRM_STATE_FIL_OLD <> PRM_STATE_FIL_NEW
Then(2f)
// Trig FARM
ACTION_FARM_TriggerOnEvent(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR,
<IN>PRM_STATE_FIL_OLD, <IN>PRM_STATE_FIL_NEW)
EndIf(2f)
Else(2a)
// Diagnostic is not in condition
LV_CDN_DIAG[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
EndIf(2a)
Else(2)
// Diagnostic deactivated by variant coding: nothing to do
EndIf(2)
Endif(0)

ACTION_ERRM_GetErrBench(<IN>PRM_IDX_ERR, <OUT>PRM_LV_BENCH)
If(0) (PRM_LV_BENCH = 1)
Then(0)
# Bench mode is active for this failure
If(1) (PRM_STATE_FIL == "PASS")
Then(1)
ACTION_ERRM_SetLvErrPrel(PRM_IDX_ERR, 0);
Else(1)
If(2) (PRM_STATE_FIL == "FAIL")
Then(2)
ACTION_ERRM_SetLvErrPrel(PRM_IDX_ERR, 1);
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
Else(0)
# This failure is not managed by the bench mode
If(1) (PRM_STATE_FIL == "PASS")
Then(1)
# No failure is present
ACTION_ERRM_Pass(PRM_IDX_ERR);
ACTION_ERRM_SetLvErrPrel(PRM_IDX_ERR, 0);
If(2) ((NLC_FMY_EOL_CUS_ENA = 1)
And
LV_FMY_EOL_CUS_ENA)
Then(2)
ACTION_GEOL_TrigErrStat(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_STATE_FIL)
Endif(2)
Else(1)
If(2) (PRM_STATE_FIL == "FAIL")
Then(2)
# Failure is present
ACTION_ERRM_Fail(PRM_IDX_ERR);
ACTION_ERRM_SetLvErrPrel(PRM_IDX_ERR, 1);
If(3) ((NLC_FMY_EOL_CUS_ENA = 1)
And
LV_FMY_EOL_CUS_ENA)
Then(3)
ACTION_GEOL_TrigErrStat(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_STATE_FIL)
Endif(3)
Else(2)
If(3)(PRM_STATE_FIL == "INTM")
Then(3)
ACTION_ERRM_RecordSporadic(PRM_IDX_ERR);
# LV_ERR_PREL is unchanged
Else(3)
# NO_EVE, INC or DEC: nothing to do
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
Endif(0)

// Index is failure based, specific treatment is called only if the

// Index is symptom based : normal API is called

Endif

ERRM, Sporadic failure manager
ACTION_ERRM_RecordSporadic (IN  <PRM_IDX_ERR>) 
This action is called for recording the sporadic failure  
Parameter  Type  Hex.Limits  Phys. Limits  Resol.  Unit  
PRM_IDX_ERR IN 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 [-] 
Diagnostic symtom instance 
 
� General Information
The purpose of this function is the visualization of those diagnosis instances that show intermittent failures,
but do not enter into the dynamic error management structure, because for example, the antibounce counter
does not reach its maximum value.
Description of C_ERR_INTM_CLR_INI :
The initialisation is active only if bit = 1. This is the correspondence bit / event :
bit 0: array is cleared at ECU reset
bit 1: array is cleared at LV_IGK 0 1 transition
bit 2: array is cleared when Error management is cleared

35.7.7 Detailed description for Action: ACTION_ERRM_ClearSporadic
When Error Management is cleared (e.g. on scan tool request or calibration transition), this action is called to
erase the sporadic failures stored.
This action erase the sporadic failures only if bit 2 of C_ERR_INTM_CLR_INI = 1

35.7.8 Detailed description for Action: ACTION_ERRM_RecordSporadic
If a failure is detected for the ?rst time this action is called by the diagnostic to store the failure index in the
array ERR_INTM_DIAG_INST[ NC_NR_ERR_INTM ]. This is done for every new failure as long as the maximum
number of entries NC_NR_ERR_INTM of this structure has not been reached. If the same failure reappears, the
frequency counter ERR_INTM_CTR_FRC [NC_NR_ERR_INTM] is incremented.

Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit

Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
C_IDX_ERR_BENCH [NC_NR_MAX_IDX_BENCH] - 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Table of diagnostic instance managed by bench mode (default value : NO_ERROR = FFFFh)
C_STATE_ERR_BENCH [NC_NR_MAX_IDX_BENCH] -
0H NO_EVE
1H PASS
2H FAIL
3H INTM
- -
Table of state for diagnostic instance managed by bench mode (0=NO_EVE; 1=PASS ; 2=FAIL)
LC_ABC_BENCH - 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Logical constant to manage the anti-bounce bench mode
LC_ABC_BENCH_LOCK_OK - 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
To force all the diagnostic true except the diag managed by bench mode (1 : enable)
� Con?guration Data
Name Mode Coded Limits Display Limits Resolution Unit
NC_NR_MAX_IDX_BENCH - 0... FFH 0... 255 1 -
Maximum number of data managed by bench mode
NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR - 0... FFFFH 0... 65535 1 -
Maximum number of diagnostic failure instances
NLC_BENCH_MODE - 0... 1H 0 ...1 1 -
Flag to remove the bench mode (When =0 the bench mode is removed, max CPU optimisation is reached)

� General Information
Remark:
If NC_NR_MAX_IDX_BENCH = 0 then C_IDX_ERR_BENCH[.] & C_STATE_ERR_BENCH[.] are not existing and
corresponding formula is not executed. In case NLC_BENCH_MODE=0 all calibration data de?ned for bench
mode manager are not existing and corresponding formula are not executed.
When NLC_BENCH_MODE = 1 the con?guration NC_NR_MAX_IDX_BENCH = 0 is not possible.
Introduction:
This module manages the bench mode. The bench mode is used during the development phase to test only
the error management and/or the application incidence (limp home or inhibition) associated to the present
failure.
This mode is active only if the LC_ABC_BENCH and NLC_BENCH_MODE ?ags are equal to 1.
The calibration LC_ABC_BENCH_LOCK_OK=1 forces, at key transition OFF to ON, all diagnostics not managed
by bench mode, to "PASS".
Description:
The management of the bench mode is done with the calibration
C_IDX_ERR_BENCH[NC_NR_MAX_IDX_BENCH]
and C_STATE_ERR_BENCH[NC_NR_MAX_IDX_BENCH]
according the following table :

This module permits to force a diagnostic to pass or fail. To force a diagnostic is necessary to change the
calibration table C_IDX_ERR_BENCH [ ]. The ?rst dimension is the diagnostic index (IDX_ERR) and the second
is the action (pass, fail or no).

35.9.2 ACTION_ERRM_FilterSymptom
Formula section:
If(0) (PRM_IDX_DIAG >= NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR_TOT)
or (PRM_IDX_DIAG < NC_IDX_ERR_FIRST_END_SPLIT)
Then(0)
// The diagnostic is not failure-based with ABC filtering
PRM_LV_ERR = 0
Else(0)
// Retrieve the 0 based index for symptom splitter management
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxEndSplitWithIdxErr(IN<PRM_IDX_DIAG>,
OUT<TMP_DIAG_INST>)
// Computation of PRM_STATE_DGO
If(1a) PRM_LV_CDN_DIAG = 0
Then(1a)
//Diag not in condition
TMP_STATE_DGO = 0
For i = 0 to 3
// Retrieve the index of the configured symptom
// When the symptom is not used, it?s equal to NO_ERROR
TMP_IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_SYM_SPLIT[TMP_DIAG_INST][i]
If TMP_IDX_ERR <> NC_IDX_ERR_NO_ERROR
Then
// Symptom i is used
ACTION_ERRM_ResultDiag(<IN>TMP_IDX_ERR,
<IN>TMP_STATE_DGO,
<OUT>TMP_STATE_FIL)
Else
// Symptom i is not used
Endif
Endfor
// lv_err_sym_split[] and err_sym[] are unchanged
PRM_LV_ERR = LV_ERR_SYM_SPLIT[TMP_DIAG_INST]
Else(1a)
// Diagnostic in condition
PRM_LV_ERR = 0
For i = 0 to 3
TMP_IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_SYM_SPLIT[TMP_DIAG_INST][i]
If TMP_IDX_ERR <> NC_IDX_ERR_NO_ERROR
Then
// Symptom i is used
If bit i of PRM_ERR_SYM = 1
Then
TMP_STATE_DGO = 3
Else
TMP_STATE_DGO = 1
Endif
// Call ResultDiag for each configured child
ACTION_ERRM_ResultDiag(<IN>TMP_IDX_ERR,
<IN>TMP_STATE_DGO,
<OUT>TMP_STATE_FIL)

If (2) TMP_IDX_ERR <> NC_IDX_ERR_NO_ERROR
Then(2)
If(3a) ERR_SYM[TMP_DIAG_INST]. bit i = 0
and
TMP_STATE_DGO.bit 1 = 1
Then(3a)
TMP_STATE_DGO_2 = 1 (CDN+NO_SYM)
Else(3a)
TMP_STATE_DGO_2 = TMP_STATE_DGO
Endif(3a)
// Normal call
ACTION_ERRM_ResultDiag(IDX_ERR, TMP_STATE_DGO_2)
If(3b) ERR_SYM[TMP_DIAG_INST]. bit i = 1
and
TMP_STATE_DGO.bit 1 = 0
Then(3b)
TMP_STATE_DGO_2 = 7 (CDN+SYM+NO_VLD)
// In case of Pass with Symptom, force symptom with NO_VLD bit
ACTION_ERRM_ResultDiag(IDX_ERR, TMP_STATE_DGO_2)
Endif(3b)
If(3c) PRM_LV_CDN_DIAG = 0 and TMP_STATE_DGO_2 <> 0
Then(3c)
ACTION_ERRM_ResultDiag(IDX_ERR, 0)
Endif(3c)
If(3e) PRM_LV_ERR = 0
Then(3e)
If(4a) ACTION_ERRM_GetErr(TMP_IDX_ERR) = 1
Then(4a)
PRM_LV_ERR = 1
Else(4a)
// No change, lv_err of child symptom is 0

PRM_LV_ERR_PND = LV_ERR_PND[PRM_IDX_DIAG]
Else(0)
#If(1) (NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR_END_SPLIT > 0)
If(2) (PRM_IDX_DIAG < NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR_TOT)
Then(2)
PRM_LV_ERR_PND = 0
// Retrieve the 0 based index for symptom splitter management
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxEndSplitWithIdxErr (IN<PRM_IDX_DIAG>,
OUT<TMP_DIAG_INST>)
For(1) i=0 to 3
TMP_IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_SYM_SPLIT[TMP_DIAG_INST][i]
If TMP_IDX_ERR <> NC_IDX_ERR_NO_ERROR
Then
PRM_LV_ERR_PND = LV_ERR_PND[TMP_IDX_ERR] | PRM_LV_ERR_
PND
Else
// Symptom is not used
Endif
Endfor(1)
Else(2)
//Invalid diagnostic index
PRM_LV_ERR_PND = 0
Endif(2)
#Else(1)
//Invalid diagnostic index
PRM_LV_ERR_PND = 0
#Endif(1)
Endif(0)

ERRM, Test of diagnostics
ERRM needs for its own veri?cation/validation some diagnostic instances in order to be independent of any
ASW diagnostics strategy.
Remark: The following chapter 2 is empty as it is not supported multiple kind of diagnostics (on current
XML template form).
35.10.1 Dummy TEST_xx diagnostics for ERRM validation
� General Information
Several diagnostic instances are needed for verifying all ERRM behaviour around diagnostic interfacings.
For Symptom based UDGI failures,
? TEST_ABC, TEST_CAL_CLAS, TEST_CONF_CLAS, TEST_ABC_16, TEST_STC, TEST_MPL and TEST_NO_FIL
instances are used for testing diagnostic not using array
? TEST_TBL[3] instances are used for testing diagnostic using array
For Symptom based 6xx failures,
? TEST_ABC_REC, TEST_NO_REC instances are used for testing diagnostic
For Failure based 4xx failures,
? TEST_SPLIT_A, TEST_SPLIT_B, TEST_SPLIT_C, TEST_SPLIT_D and TEST_SPLIT_E instances are used for
testing diagnostic
Remark: Failure based 4xx are supported only with usage of symptom splitter.
Regarding to all data de?ned,
yy = each of the following (for all runtime related data):
TEST_ABC
TEST_CAL_CLAS
TEST_CONF_CLAS
TEST_ABC_16
TEST_STC
TEST_MPL
TEST_NO_FIL
TEST_ABC_REC
TEST_NO_REC
TEST_SPLIT_A/B/C/D/E (using symptom splitter mechanism)
� Function Description
35.10.1.1 Dummy TEST_xx diagnostics for ERRM validation with UDGI interfaces
General information:
These dummy test diagnostics (refer to TEST_xx instances) are intended to test the interface between diag-
nostics and Error management :
? The calibration LC_DIAG_CDN_TEST is used to set the diagnostic condition

? The calibration LC_DIAG_TEST_VAR_COD is used to permit the call of the variant coding
? The calibration LC_DIAG_NOT_VLD_TEST permit to set the diagnostic result valid or not valid

TEST_TBL ACTION_ERRM_ResetDiagTest 0..2

For I = 0 to 2
STATE_DIAG_TEST_TBL[i] = 0
EndFor
Read value of SYSTEM_TICK_DURATION from IO layer via OS interface
Recurrence: 100 ms
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Function description:
This dummy TEST_TBL diagnostic is intended to test the interface between UDGI diagnostics and Error Man-
agement.
Formula section:
For i=0 to 2
Condition calculation
If(1a) LC_DIAG_CDN_TEST_TBL[i] = 1
Then(1a)
Symptom detection
If(2a) LC_SYM_TEST_TBL[i] = 1
Then(2a)
TMP_STATE_DGO =3 (CDN+SYM) (Symptom active)
Else(2a)
TMP_STATE_DGO =1 (CDN+NO_SYM) (Symptom active)
Endif(2a)
Else(1a)
TMP_STATE_DGO = 0 (No condition)
Endif(1a)
The diagnostic result is delivered

IN<TMP_STATE_DGO>, OUT<PRM_STATE_FIL>)
Update of diagnostic state one time to check the diagnostic is running

35.11.1 Process to manage splitting of diagnostic initialization (Clear)
� General Information
This module permits to initialize the diagnostic (Clear) by package.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event:
LV_ERR_CLR_FMY_OBD = 0
LV_ERR_CLR_FMY_ACT = 0
LV_ERR_CLR_DIAG_ACT = 0
CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR = FFFFh
Activation: CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR <> FFFFh
Deactivation: CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR = FFFFh
Recurrence: 10 ms
� Function Description
For(1) PRM_IDX_ERR = CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR to (CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR +
C_CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC) (limited to NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR)
# Action called to clear diagnostic
If (1) LV_STATE_INI_DIAG_IGK_RST = 1
Then(1)
If(2) (bit 0 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR]=0
and bit 0 of LF_STATE_IGK_RST = 1)
or
(bit 1 of C_ABC_INI_TYP[PRM_IDX_ERR]=0
and bit 1 of LF_STATE_IGK_RST = 1)

expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
ERRM, Diagnosis callback manager
or
bit 7 of LF_STATE_IGK_RST = 1
Then(2)
ACTION_ERRM_RequestDiagClear(PRM_IDX_ERR)
Endif(2)
Else(1)
ACTION_ERRM_RequestDiagClear(PRM_IDX_ERR)
Endif(1)
Endfor(1)
CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR = C_CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR + C_CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC + 1
If(1) CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR > NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR # Last diagnostic initialized
Then(1)
# End of initialization process
ACTION_ERRM_SetClearingStatus (?DIAG?, ?END?)
CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR = FFFFh
// Inform FARM that initialization process has finished.
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(NC_IDX_FID_CLR_DIAG, 0)
Endif(1)

35.11.3 ACTION_ERRM_SetClearingStatus
General information:
This action is used to set global clearing status depending on PRM_CLR_TYPE and PRM_CLR_STATE.
Formula section:
# Handling of core parts
If(1) PRM_CLR_TYPE = ?FMY?
Then(1)
If(2) PRM_CLR_STATE = ?START?
Then(2)
LV_ERR_CLR_FMY_OBD = 1 # Global clearing started
LV_ERR_CLR_FMY_ACT = 1 # Global clearing for core parts started
Endif(2)
If(2) PRM_CLR_STATE = ?END?
Then(2)
LV_ERR_CLR_FMY_ACT = 0 # Global clearing for core parts ended
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
# Handling of diagnostics parts
If(1) PRM_CLR_TYPE = ?DIAG?
Then(1)
If(2) PRM_CLR_STATE = ?START? # Global clearing for diag parts started
Then(2)
LV_ERR_CLR_DIAG_ACT = 1
Endif(2)
If(2) PRM_CLR_STATE = ?END?
Then(2)
LV_ERR_CLR_FMY_OBD = 0 # Global clearing ended
LV_ERR_CLR_DIAG_ACT = 0 # Global clearing for diag parts started
Endif(2)
Endif(1)

35.11.4 ACTION_ERRM_TrigClrRest6xx
General information:
This action is used to clear or restart all diagnostics 6.x.x types.
Formula section:
// Starting clearing & restart process only for 6.x.x diagnostics type if existing
If NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR_ABC_REC > 0
and
CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_REST > NC_IDX_ERR_FIRST_ABC_REC
Then
CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_REST = NC_IDX_ERR_FIRST_ABC_REC
LV_STATE_INI_DIAG_IGK_RST = 1
bit 0 of LF_STATE_IGK_RST = 1 if PRM_STATE_EVE = 0
bit 1 of LF_STATE_IGK_RST = 1 if PRM_STATE_EVE = 1
Endif
35.11.5 ACTION_ERRM_TrigClrRest
General information:
This action is used to clear or restart all diagnsotics depending on PRM_STATE_INI.
Formula section:
If(1) PRM_STATE_INI = ?CLR?
and
CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR = FFFFh
Then(1)
# Clear all diagnostics
ACTION_ERRM_SetClearingStatus (?DIAG?, ?START?)
CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_CLR = 0
// Inform FARM that initialization process has started.
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(NC_IDX_FID_CLR_DIAG, 0x40)
bit 7 of LF_STATE_IGK_RST = 1
Endif(1)
If(2) PRM_STATE_INI = ?REST?
Then(2)
# Restart all diagnostics if any action is not running
CTR_INI_DIAG_CLC_REST = 0
// Inform FARM that initialization process has started.
ACTION_FARM_SetAuxiliaryStatus(NC_IDX_FID_REST_DIAG, 00x40)
bit 7 of LF_STATE_IGK_RST = 1
Endif(2)

35.11.6 ACTION_ERRM_RequestDiagClear
General information:
This action is used to clear the diagnostic instance PRM_IDX_ERR. The request would come from communica-
tion tool.
Formula section:
If(1) PRM_IDX_ERR < NC_IDX_ERR_FIRST_ABC_REC
Then(1)
ACTION_ERRM_RequestDiagClearUdgi (PRM_IDX_ERR)
Else(1)
# For each entry select the good one for cleared
If(2) PRM_IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_ERR_XX
Then(2)
ACTION_AGGR_ResetDiagXx (?CLR?, NR_CONF[PRM_IDX_ERR])
Else(2)
No action
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
Note:
By means of the identi?er PRM_IDX_ERR, the corresponding action ACTION_AGGR_ResetDiagXx is selected
from ?table of diagnostic instances and the supported actions? and called with the respective value NR_CONF[PRM_
IDX_ERR] and parameter ?CLR?.
When ACTION_AGGR_ResetDiagXx is not supported by diagnostic, a dummy one shall be used instead: AC-
TION_ERRM_ResetDiagDummy

35.11.8 ACTION_ERRM_RequestGetSdr
General information:
This actions is used to get the diagnostic speci?c data for instance PRM_IDX_ERR.
Formula section:
If(1) PRM_IDX_ERR < NC_IDX_ERR_FIRST_ABC_REC
Then(1)
ACTION_ERRM_RequestUdgiGetSdr (PRM_IDX_ERR)
Else(1)
# For each entry select the good Action to be called to get diagnostic data
If(2) PRM_IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_ERR_XX
Then(2)
# Case action ACTION_AGGR_GetSdrXx for diagnostic XX has been
# defined in table of failure
ACTION_AGGR_GetSdrXx (OUT<PRM_STATE_DIAG>, OUT<PRM_ABC>,
OUT<PRM_ABC_INC>, OUT<PRM_ABC_DEC>, OUT<PRM_ABC_MAX>,
IN<NR_CONF[PRM_IDX_ERR]>)
# Case action ACTION_ERRM_GetSdrDummy has been defined
# for diagnostic XX instead of ACTION_AGGR_GetSdrXx
ACTION_ERRM_GetSdrDummy (IN<0>, OUT <PRM_STATE_DIAG>, OUT<PRM_ABC>,
OUT<PRM_ABC_INC>, OUT<PRM_ABC_DEC>, OUT<PRM_ABC_MAX>)
If(3) PRM_STATE_DIAG.bit 7 = 1
Then
# default calibrations
PRM_ABC_INC = 127
PRM_ABC_DEC = 127
PRM_ABC_MAX = 127
PRM_STATE_DIAG.bit 0 = ACTION_ERRM_GetCdnDiag(PRM_IDX_ERR)
PRM_STATE_DIAG.bit 1 = ACTION_ERRM_GetSym(PRM_IDX_ERR)
ACTION_ERRM_GetStatus(IN<PRM_IDX_ERR>, OUT<PRM_STATE_ERR>)
If (4) PRM_STATE_ERR.bit 0 = 1 #LV_ERR
Then (4)
PRM_ABC = 127 #ABC
Else (4)
# PRM_STATE_ERR.bit 0 = 0
If(5) PRM_STATE_ERR.bit 5 = 1 #LV_END
Then(5)
PRM_ABC = - 127 #ABC
Else(5)
ABC = 0
Endif(5)
Endif (4)
Endif(3)
Else(2)
No action
Endif(2)
Endif(1)

ERRM, Diagnosis callback manager (Appl. Inc.)
For UDS communication service purpose (Service $22 InUseMonitoringPerformanceRatio), it is required to
make a link between CDT-numbers used for MVB outputs and rate-based monitoring index. CDT-numbers
used are de?ned by the mean of customer DTC (C_ERR_DTC_CUS).
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event
# CDT_RBM[NC_NR_DIAG_RBM] array is filled-up with customer
DTC
If NLC_NR_DTC_FMT = 1
Then
# Customer DTC is enabled
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM do
IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_TBL_DIAG_RBM[m]
If IDX_ERR < NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR
Then
CDT_RBM[m] = C_ERR_DTC_CUS[IDX_ERR]
Else
CDT_RBM[m] = 0000h
Endif
Endfor
Else
# Customer DTC is not enabled : default value is given
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM do
CDT_RBM[m] = 0000h
Endfor
Endif
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Recurrence: -

No treatment

� General Information
This diagnosis is for additional information in case of failures with low fuel tank level.
In case of a low fuel tank level (LV_FRS = 1) an undersupply of fuel could happen and cause engine malfunctions.
This will be recognized by several diagnosis. This can cause wrong failure detection. Therefore this diagnosis
will set an additional failure (P1250) in case of failure detections with active fuel reserve signal.

� General Information
Click here to insert a short summary
This module is the core of ERRM aggregate.
It de?nes the principles and mechanism of dynamic error management function.
Dynamic error management provide a fault memory with a limited size which depends on the total amount
of diagnostics within the system.
The Dynamic error management collects data results from diagnostics (may be ?ltered by anti-bounce algo-
rithm) and manages different data required by CARB or EOBD standards:
- Trip counter
- Warm-up counter
- Healing counter
- MIL activation
- Fault status
In addition, this module uses generic services de?ned by others modules from ERRM (e.g. priority rules, similar
driving conditions).

35.14.1 Diagnostic fault description : failure de?nition
� General Information
Dynamic error management manages failures entries, theirs different states and related data.
Entry failure (LV_ERR_REC[IDX_ERR])
The entry failure is the diagnostic result failed after the post-analyser. The real entry point of the error manage-
ment is the entry failure.
Present failure (LV_ERR[IDX_ERR])
The present failure is a copied of entry failure and reset by the post-diagnostic analyser.
Pending failure (LV_ERR_PND[IDX_DYN])
The failure is pending when the failure becomes present and is no more pending after a complete driving
cycle without failure present and diagnostic done (Diagnostic passed).
Failure set since last clear LV_ERR_LST_CLR[IDX_ERR]
The failure has been set already once since the last failure memory clear.
Disappeared failure (LV_ERR_DISA[IDX_DYN])

A failure is considered as disappeared, when no failure was detected during a complete driving cycle and the
failure wasn?t con?rmed. It leaves this state either when the failure reoccurs or when the warm-up counter
reaches 0.
Con?rmed failure (LV_ERR_CFM[IDX_DYN])
A failure is considered as con?rmed when the driving cycle counter reaches the maximum value and leaves
this state when the warm-up counter reaches 0.

35.14.2 Driving and warm-up cycle counter management : Warm-up counter manage-
ment
� General Information
As soon as the failure gets present and stored in the memory, the warm-up cycle counter is initialized.
With every valid warm-up cycle with no error occurrence, the warm-up cycle counter is incremented by 1. If
the warm-up cycle counter reaches zero the error is deleted from the 2nd layer memory.
This API is called to treat the warm-up counter management at the end of driving cycle.
� Application Conditions

CYCNR_WUP[IDX_DYN]= 0

ERRM, Dynamic error management core
To reduce the RAM consumption, the memory is shared in two layers: the static memory called 1 st layer
and the dynamic memory called 2 nd layer. In fact the failure number managed in the error management is
limited because the failure number managed at the same period is limited. For this reason, some data can be
managed in the 2nd layer but other data must be managed in the static memory due to the functionality (e.g.:
present failure, a present failure can activate limp home, for this reason the present failure must be delivered
for each diagnostic).
For the ?rst layer; the failure number structure is limited to a maximum value de?ned by NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR
and for the second layer; the failure number structure is limited to a maximum value de?ned by NC_NR_ERR_
DYN.
- Failure present 
- Failure information following the post-analyser 
- Failure information following the diagnostic result 
- Failure already present since last clear 
- Pending failure status flag 
- Failure is stored in dynamic memory 
- Failure managed by the bench mode

- Disappeared failure 
- Failure present status for this driving cycle 
- Memorized MIL activation flag 
- Marked failure

35.14.4.1 Failures con?guration
Description:
For each diagnostic two classes are de?ned in order to con?gure the failure behavior within error manage-
ment function. These classes are called ?failure classes A and B?. The following items can be in?uenced:
? control of dashboard lamp (MIL and/or Warning lamp 1 and/or Warning lamp 2)
? the emission relevance of a failure
? failure priority, used for failure storage
The de?nition of these classes is done in Failure Class module.
35.14.5 Driving and warm-up cycle counter management : Driving Cycle counter man-
agement
� General Information
The driving cycle counter CTR_DC[IDX_DYN] is associated to each failure which has a structure de?ned in
second layer of memory.
This counter is incremented at each driving cycle with the following rules:
? For all failures not concerned by similar conditions functionality or when similar conditions strategy is
deactivated(LC_ENA_SCDN=0 or NLC_ENA_SCDN=0), when failure gets present (LV_ERR_DC[IDX_DYN]).
? For failures using similar conditions functionality with similar condition activated (LC_ENA_SCDN=1 and
NLC_ENA_SCDN=1):
- when the failure gets present the ?rst time (and stored)
- when the failure gets present again in a following driving cycle
- when the failure gets present again in another driving cycle (not previous)
(driving cycle counter of this failure is between 0 and maximum value before new occurrence),
if the similar conditions functionality decides, that the increment is possible.
The driving cycle counter is decremented at the end of a driving cycle in the following cases:
? For all failures not concerned by similar conditions functionality or when similar condition is deactivated
(LC_ENA_SCDN=0 or NLC_ENA_SCDN=0), when failure has not been detected during the whole driving
cycle (LV_ERR_DC[IDX_DYN] = 0) and diagnostic is passed.

The driving cycle counter is useful for MIL management and warm-up counter management (see speci?c

35.14.10 Inhibitions calculations when ECU is in end of line mode
� General Information
The purpose of this function is to compute individual inhibitions caused by end of line mode activation.
With C_STATE_OBD_EOL it is possible to select functionalities which are inhibited by such special mode :
- readiness codes calculation
- individual numerators rate-base monitoring
End of line mode, once activated, is maintained until end of driving cycle.
bit 0: Readiness code computation inhibition while in end of line mode 
bit 1: Individual numerators computations inhibition while in end of line mode 
bit 2: not supported 
bit 3: not supported 
bit 4: not supported 
bit 5: not supported 
bit 6: not supported 
bit 7: not supported 
Figure 35.14.5: C_STATE_OBD_EOL inhibitions de?nition for end of line mode
When setting LC_ENA_OBD_EOL_TEST = 1 it possible to simulate the end of line mode.

35.14.12 ACTION_ERRM_Pass
Description:
Diagnostic is passed.
This action noti?es to error management that IDX_ERR diagnostic has been passed.
A diagnostic is passed successfully when:
- LV_ERR[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
- LV_END_DIAG[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
Readiness calculation
A readiness ?ag is de?ned for each diagnostic (LV_READY[PRM_IDX_ERR]).
Readiness ?ags are mainly used by aftermarket service and inspections maintenance.
When after market achieves a repair, the system should be controlled before giving back the car to its owner
(refer to ?readiness codes? speci?cation?)
In case the diagnostic did not detect any fault, the readiness is set to 0 when the diagnostic is completed.In
end of line mode (LV_OBD_EOL = 1), the readiness code calculation may be inhibited, depending on C_STATE_
OBD_EOL calibration.
The readiness ?ag LV_READY[PRM_IDX_ERR] indicates:
- LV_READY[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1 = > diagnostic PRM_IDX_ERR "not ready" since last diagnostic information
clear
- LV_READY[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0 = >diagnostic PRM_IDX_ERR "ready" since last diagnostic information clear
To monitor the failure, ACTION_ERRM_TrigErrDyn shall be called when the failure is removed.
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
LV_ERR_REC[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
If(0) LV_END_DIAG[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
and
bit 0 of STATE_OBD_EOL = 0
Then(0)
# First passed without previous failed in the current
# driving cycle
LV_READY[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
Endif(0)
LV_END_DIAG[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
If(0) LV_ERR[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
Then(0)
# To monitor the failure, ACTION_ERRM_TrigErrDyn shall be
# called when the failure is removed.
PRM_STATUS_ERR = ERR_RST
LV_ERR[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
ACTION_ERRM_TrigErrDyn(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_STATUS_ERR)
Endif(0)

35.14.13 ACTION_ERRM_Fail
Description:
diagnostic has failed.
This action stores the IDX_ERR failure if possible. When a failure occurs (becomes present), this failure shall
be stored in the 2nd layer memory (if possible). If the 2 nd layer memory is full, and priority rules are enabled
(NLC_OBD_ENA_PRI = 1) and marked mode is not set.
Priority rules module will determine in which location of ERRM dynamic memory the failure may be stored(ACTION_
ERRM_ClcPriorityRule):
- if the failure can be stored in the 2nd layer memory, PRM_IDX_DYN gives the index of the failure to be removed
from the dynamic memory
- if the failure can?t be stored in the 2nd layer memory, then PRM_IDX_DYN = FFH
- to monitor the failure, ACTION_ERRM_TrigErrDyn shall be called when the failure occurs.
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
LV_ERR_PND_STAT[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
LV_ERR_LST_CLR[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
LV_ERR_LST_IGK[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
Only with passed (PASS) or not completed diagnostic (restarted) and not in dynamic
memory
If(1) LV_ERR[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
or
(LV_END_DIAG[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
and
LV_ERR_MEM[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0)
Then(1)
If(2) CTR_ERR_DYN_NR < NC_NR_ERR_DYN
or
LV_ERR_MEM[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
Then(2)
ACTION_ERRM_StoreErr(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_IDX_DYN)
Else(2)
If(3) LV_MKD_MOD = 0
# Marked mode not set
and
# Priority rules activated
NLC_OBD_ENA_PRI = 1
Then(3)
ACTION_ERRM_ClcPriorityRules(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_IDX_DYN)
If(4) PRM_IDX_DYN <> FFH
Then(4)
#IF NLC_NOX_ERRM_ENA = 1
#THEN
If LC_NOX_ERRM_ENA = 1
Then
ACTION_ERRM_UpdNoxMemAfterPrio(DIAG_INST[IDX])
Endif
#ENDIF

#IF NLC_NOX_ERRM_ENA = 1
#THEN

Then

# No gap created
NR_GAP = 0

ACTION_ERRM_DecrementDCctr(IDX_DYN, TMP_DC_GAP)
If TMP_DC_GAP = 0
Then
# Current number of gaps not changed: no gap created
# due to DC cycle counter decrement
ACTION_ERRM_IncrementWUPctr(IDX_DYN, TMP_WUP_GAP)
If TMP_WUP_GAP = 1
And
NLC_CTR_AGI_ENA = 0
Then
# Increment current number of gaps created
NR_GAP = NR_GAP + 1
Else
# Current number of gaps not changed: no gap
# created due to WUP cycle counter decrement
Endif
Else
# Increment current number of gaps created
NR_GAP = NR_GAP + 1

IDX_ERR = DIAG_INST[IDX_DYN]
If LV_ERR_PND[IDX_DYN] = 1
Then
LV_ERR_PND_STAT[IDX_ERR] = 1

Then

35.14.16 ACTION_ERRM_IncrementDCctr
Description:
Conditions to increment the driving cycle counter
This action manages IDX_ERR failure driving cycle counter stored in the dynamic memory of ERRM at the
position PRM_IDX _DYN.
This action is called when the IDX_ERR failure is stored (by the ACTION_ERRM_Fail (<IDX_ERR>)) or called by
similar conditions functionality.
A readiness ?ag is de?ned for each diagnostic (LV_READY[IDX_ERR]).
In case of failure detection, the readiness is set to 0 (i.e. completed, ready, done, ...) when the fault is con?rmed
(MIL is illuminated at the same time).
In end of line mode (LV_OBD_EOL = 1), the readiness code calculation may be inhibited, depending on C_
STATE_OBD_EOL calibration.
The readiness ?ag LV_READY[IDX_ERR] indicates:
- LV_READY[IDX_ERR] = 1 =>diagnostic "not ready" since last diagnostic information clear
- LV_READY[IDX_ERR] = 0 =>diagnostic "ready" since last diagnostic information clear
MIL Grouping
If a failure (A) gets present, then for each of the other group members it is checked, what would happen, if this
monitor would detect the failure in this moment.
The resulting cycle counter with the highest value (and the resulting MIL request) out of these scenarii is
applied for failure A.

35.14.19 ACTION_ERRM_IncrementWupCtr - Private action
Description:
This private action is called to manage the warm-up counter at the end of driving cycle (called by ACTION_
ERRM_ResetDc).
With NLC_CTR_AGI_ENA, it is possible to avoid standard clearing of DISA failure when related warm-up counter
reaches the related threshold (expected need for some customers).
PRM_RESULT is used for tracking if a failure erasing is performed inside dynamic memory at PRM_IDX_DYN
position:
PRM_RESULT = 0: No gap created
PRM_RESULT = 1: One gap created
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
PRM_RESULT = 0
If(0) PRM_IDX_DYN < CTR_ERR_DYN_NR
Then(0)
# Index PRM_IDX_DYN valid
Condition to increment the warm-up counter:
If(1) # The warm-up cycle is recognized and failure healing is possible
(LV_WUP_CYC = 1 and CYCNR_WUP[PRM_IDX_DYN] != 255)
and
# MIL is extinguished
CTR_DC_PREV = 0
and
(
# No failure within this driving cycle
LV_ERR_DC[PRM_IDX_DYN] = 0
or
# Case before the MIL may be illuminated and the failure is no more
pending
(LV_DC_MAX_PREV = 0 and LV_ERR_PND[PRM_IDX_DYN] = 0)
)
Then(1)
If(2) CYCNR_WUP[PRM_IDX_DYN] < 255
Then(2)
CYCNR_WUP[PRM_IDX_DYN] = CYCNR_WUP[PRM_IDX_DYN] + 1
Endif(2)
If(2) NLC_CTR_AGI_ENA = 0
Then(2)
# Standard strategy of warm-up aging: clearing of DISA failure
# when warm-up counter reaches dedicated threshold
If(3) CYCNR_WUP[PRM_IDX_DYN] = C_CYCNR_MAX_WUP
Then(3)
# NOX Monitoring elec fault treatment
#IF NLC_NOX_ERRM_ENA = 1
#THEN
File: 7EB02201.00L

Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

If LC_NOX_ERRM_ENA = 1
Then
ACTION_ERRM_ResetNOxElecFault(DIAG_INST[PRM_IDX_DYN])
Endif
#ENDIF
ACTION_ERRM_EraseErr(PRM_IDX_DYN)
# One gap is created at PRM_IDX_DYN position due to

PRM_RESULT = 1

35.14.20 ACTION_ERRM_StoreErr - Private action
Description:
Store / Erase a failure in 2nd layer memory
This private action manages the "Entry" (storage) in the 2 nd layer memory. The failure PRM_IDX_ERR is taken
account into the 2nd layer memory and the frequency counter (number of occurrences of present failure) is
updated;
- the DTC is stored with ACTION_ERRM_StoreDtc (IN<PRM_IDX_DYN>) (if needed)
- the Freeze Frame is stored with ACTION_ERRM_StoreFrf (IN<PRM_IDX_DYN>)
- the index of diagnostic instance ?PRM_IDX_ERR? is stored in DIAG_INST[PRM_IDX_DYN] for the link with the
index of dynamic memory and visualization
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
If(0) PRM_IDX_ERR < NC_MAX_IDX_ERR
Then(0)
If(1) LV_ERR_MEM[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
Then(1)
# Failure PRM_IDX_ERR is stored now in 2nd layer memory
PRM_IDX_DYN = CTR_ERR_DYN_NR
DIAG_INST[PRM_IDX_DYN] = PRM_IDX_ERR
# DTC information storage
ACTION_ERRM_StoreDtc (PRM_IDX_DYN)
LV_ERR_MEM[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1
CTR_ERR_DYN_NR = CTR ERR_DYN_NR + 1

# Dynamic index valid

Then(3)

Then(4)
# Saturation to 254 : value 255 forbidden

Endif(4)
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
If(2) CTR_FRC[PRM_IDX_DYN] < 255
Then(2)
CTR_FRC[PRM_IDX_DYN] = CTR_FRC[PRM_IDX_DYN] + 1
Endif(2)
# Initialize the warm-up counter
CYCNR_WUP[PRM_IDX_DYN] = 0
LV_ERR_PND[PRM_IDX_DYN] = 1
If(2) LV_ERR_REC[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 0
Then(2)
# FRF information storage
ACTION_ERRM_StoreFrf(PRM_IDX_DYN)
# ARSD FRF information storage
ACTION_ARSD_StoreFrf(ERR_DTC[PRM_IDX_DYN], PRM_IDX_ERR)

If(2) LV_ERR_DISA[PRM_IDX_DYN] = 1
Then(2)

Endif(2)
Else(1)
# Invalid dynamic index (related index not inside dynamic memory)
Endif(1)
Else(0)
# Invalid PRM_IDX_ERR
PRM_IDX_DYN = CTR_ERR_DYN_NR
Endif(0)

35.14.21 ACTION_ERRM_EraseErr - Private action
Description:
Store / Erase a failure in 2nd layer memory
This private action manages the ?Exit? (deleting) of failures out of the 2nd layer memory.
The failure IDX_ERR (with IDX_ERR = DIAG_INST[PRM_IDX_DYN]) is taken out of the 2nd layer memory and the
failure is stored in history memory with ACTION_ERRM_StoreHistory (IN<PRM_IDX_DYN>).
The DTC of the failure is erased with ACTION_ERRM_EraseDtc (IN<PRM_IDX_DYN>).
The Freeze Frame of the failure is erased with ACTION_ERRM_EraseFrf (IN<PRM_IDX_DYN>).
The similar conditions of the failure are erased with ACTION_ERRM_EraseScdn (IN<IDX_ERR>) if the failure
uses the similar conditions functionality.
In the principle, this action performs one gap inside such 2nd layer memory and update accordingly CTR_
ERR_DYN_NR.
Remark: the following treatment could be optimized at core resource consumption (especially inside related
critical section).
WARNING: the handling of CTR_ERR_DYN_NR is moved to ACTION_ERRM_HandleResorting! Then, hard de-
pendancy between both functions.
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
If(0) PRM_IDX_DYN < CTR_ERR_DYN_NR
Then(0)
# Dynamic index valid
IDX_ERR = DIAG_INST[PRM_IDX_DYN]
# Search if IDX_ERR failure uses similar conditions functionality
For(1) k = 0 to (NC_NR_WIN_SCDN - 1)
If(2) NC_IDX_INST_SCDN[k] = IDX_ERR
Then(2)
IDX_ERR failure uses SCDN functionality
Exit For loop
Endif(2)
Endfor(1)
ACTION_ERRM_StoreHistory(PRM_IDX_DYN)
ACTION_ERRM_TrigErasedErrDyn(PRM_IDX_DYN)
If(1) IDX_ERR failure uses SCDN functionality
And
NLC_ENA_SCDN = 1
And
LC_ENA_SCDN = 1
Then(1)
ACTION_ERRM_EraseScdn(IDX_ERR)
Endif(1)

35.14.22 ACTION_ERRM_HandleResorting - Private action
Description:
Store / Erase a failure in 2nd layer memory;
This private action manages the ?Resorting? of failures of the 2nd layer memory after any ?Exit? (deleting) of
failures out of such layer memory.
The following schema describes the resorting performed on one failure to be deleted:
Figure 35.14.9:
In the principle, this action performs the resorting of the 2nd layer memory with removing all gap(s) generated
by ACTION_ERRM_EraseErr.
In case PRM_IDX_DYN is equal to NC_NR_ERR_DYN, it means that the resorting has to handle several gaps
which are existing inside such layer memory. Otherwise, it means that the resorting has to handle only the
gap generated by previous clearing above.
Remark: the following treatment could be optimized at core resource consumption (especially inside related
critical section).
PRM_NR_GAP indicates how many gaps had been introduced (normally related to call number of ACTION_
ERRM_EraseErr.

Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -

# Remove empty space generated by current PRM_IDX_DYN position
If(1) PRM_IDX_DYN < (NC_NR_ERR_DYN - 1)
Then(1)
# Error to be cleared has been found and its position is not the

ERRM, Cycle manager
ACTION_ERRM_StoreCon?rmedCode()
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(IN <PRM_FID>, OUT <PRM_LV_PRMS>)
� General Information
This speci?cation describes how are computed the different OBD cycles : driving cycle, warm-up cycle, igni-
tion cycle, standardized vehicle operation cycle for rate-based monitoring (i.e. in-use performance ratio) or
permanent fault code.
35.16.1 Driving Cycle Management
� General Information
For combustion engines (no hybrid): A driving cycle starts with "ignition on" and ends with the next time
"ignition on" if the engine has reached the ?rst engine start conditions for at least 2 seconds (C_T_OBD_QLD
parameter) continuously in between. In this case, OBD driving cycle is quali?ed. Engine stops which are not
caused by the driver or ECU don?t end the driving cycle.
For hybrids and engines with shutoff strategies, the driving cycle is de?ned as the time between ?ignition on?
and the next time "ignition on" if either the engine has reached the ?rst engine start conditions or condition
ready for driving, for both during at least 2 seconds (C_T_OBD_QLD parameter) continuously, while ignition key
is ON. In this case, OBD driving cycle is quali?ed. Engine start conditions shall be equivalent to conventional
power trains (e.g. engine speed and electric motor speed).
In addition, two strategies may be activated in order to end driving cycle after a too long trip (mileage or time
criteria are used).
In addition, a new driving cycle may be triggered in case of global clearing of ERRM data requested by Mode
$04 with Scan Tool or OEM tester request. This feature may be enabled or disable by calibration.
With LC_DC_ERU_ENA = 1, ignition key transition while engine is running triggers a new driving cycle if OBD
driving cycle has been quali?ed in previous cycle.
With LC_DC_ERU_ENA = 0, ignition key transition while engine and electric motor are stopped triggers a new
driving cycle if OBD driving cycle has been quali?ed in previous cycle.
LV_OBD_QLD is set to 1 when OBD driving cycle has been quali?ed.
T_OBD_QLD corresponds to time elapsed since OBD start (last start for combustion engine or last ready for
driving state for hybrid vehicle) until OBD driving cycle is quali?ed. T_OBD_QLD is frozen when ignition key is
switch off and when OBD driving cycle is quali?ed.
OBD driving cycle has to be quali?ed again in case of new driving cycle (LV_OBD_QLD and T_OBD_QLD reset
in ACTION_ERRM_StartDC).
Reset of T_OBD_QLD in case of ignition key off to on consists in restarting timing condition when current
OBD driving cycle is not quali?ed. Reset of T_OBD_QLD has no effect if OBD driving cycle has already been
quali?ed.

LV_OBD_QLD = 0
At RST system event

35.16.2 Warm-Up Cycle and Warm-Up Status
� General Information
Warm-up cycle de?nition depends on type of vehicle :
- combustion engine or hybrid vehicle (LC_DC_EL_VEH = 0)
- electric vehicle (LC_DC_EL_VEH = 1)
Warm-up cycle for combustion engine or hybrid vehicle
?Warm-up cycle? means suf?cient vehicle operation such that the coolant temperature has risen by at least
40 degrees Fahrenheit from engine starting and reaches a minimum temperature of at least 160 degrees
Fahrenheit (140 degrees Fahrenheit for applications with diesel engines).
The detection of the warm-up cycle is based on the engine coolant temperature. The warm-up cycle is de-
tected as soon as the coolant temperature reaches C_TCO_WUP_THD and has risen by at least C_TCO_WUP_
INC from engine starting. These values are de?ned by the regulation.
The application must guarantee the warm-up cycle detection, even in case of coolant temperature sensor
error.
Therefore, if a coolant temperature sensor error has been logged, the threshold for warm-up cycle detection
is referred to the backup coolant temperature value computed by the engine control (see chapter ?Diagnosis
and emergency operation?).
The warm-up cycle detection is enabled only if engine or electric motor is started and if engine temperature
at start is lower than a threshold C_TCO_ST_MAX_INH_WUP_CYC (customer requirement 71,1�C).
Warm Up cycle for electric vehicle
OBD status information ?Warm-up cycle" (LV_WUP_CYC) is set if the following conditions are ful?lled :
Cumulated trip length (time since engine start) T_AST_WUP >= C_T_AST_WUP (customer requirement 600
s)

General mechanism
The warm-up status is needed for similar driving conditions test, and indicates if engine is "warm" or "cold".
ACTION_ERRM_IncCtrWupDtcClr() is called in order to increment the variable "Warm-up Counter Since Last
DTC Clear", within Statistical data module.
The warm-up cycle detection is activated if warm-up cycle is not inhibited (LV_INH_WUP_CYC set to 0) and
OBD driving cycle is quali?ed (LV_OBD_QLD set to 1).
Within STATE_DC_WUP the different conditions necessary to set LV_WUP_CYC are visualized.

35.16.3 Warm-Up Cycle inhibition
� General Information
The warm-up cycle can be inhibited (e.g. in case of coolant temperature fault the warm-up cycle evaluation is
not possible). All required inhibition conditions shall be speci?ed within the FAult Reaction Manager.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event
LV_INH_WUP_CYC = 0
Activation: Always
Deactivation: Never
Recurrence: 100 ms
� Function Description
# Conditions for warm-up cycle inhibit shall be specified within FARM
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_WUP_CYC, PRM_LV_PRMS)
LV_INH_WUP_CYC = not(PRM_LV_PRMS)
35.16.4 Time elapsed since driving cycle start
� General Information
The purpose is to calculate the time elapsed since driving cycle has started, excepted when ECU is in pre or
post-operating phase.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At NVMINI system event
T_DC = 0 s
At RST system event
T_DC is restored from NVMY
Activation: Always
Deactivation: Never
Recurrence: 1 s
� Function Description
If(0) LV_OBD_POP = 0 # Pre or post-operating phase not active
Then(0)
If(1) T_DC < 65535 s
Then(1)
# Maximum value is not reached
T_DC = T_DC + 1 s
Else(1)
# Timer shall not wrap around to 0
T_DC = 65535 s
Endif(1)
Else(0)
T_DC is frozen
Endif(0)

35.16.5 Time since engine start calculation with SAE format - PID $1F
� General Information
SAE J1979 standard
"For non-hybrid vehicles, RUNTM shall increment while the engine is running. It shall freeze if the engine stalls.
RUNTM shall be reset to zero during every control module power-up and when entering the key on, engine off
position. RUNTM is limited to 65535 seconds and shall not wrap around to zero.
For hybrid vehicles, RUNTM shall increment after the ignition switch is turned to the on position and the engine
is running, or, if the vehicle can be started in electric- only mode, RUNTM shall increment after the ignition
switch is turned to the on position and the vehicle starts to move. It shall continue to increment even if the
engine is turned off by the vehicle control system. RUNTM shall be reset to zero during every control module
power-up and when entering the key-on, engine off position. RUNTM is limited to 65535 seconds and shall not
wrap around to zero."
T_AST_SAE is set to 0 when a new driving cycle is started.
T_AST_SAE shall start to increment when OBD driving cycle is quali?ed (LV_OBD_QLD = 1).
Start/stop vehicle:
If the vehicle is stopped due to a stop&start strategy (LV_STALL = 0 and LV_OBD_ES = 1), the RUNTM shall
continue to increment even if the engine is turned off by the vehicle control system. It?s the reason that LV_
STALL must be considered if the engine is stalled unintentionally.
Engine stalling:
A calibratable option exists that enable/disable counting during engine stalled state.
With LC_INC_PID_1F_STALL = 1, PID $1F may be incremented when engine is stalled.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event
T_AST_SAE = 0 s
Activation: Always
Deactivation: Never
Recurrence: 1 s
� Function Description
If(0) LV_OBD_QLD = 1 # OBD driving cycle qualified
Then(0)
# OBD driving cycle qualified
If(1) LV_OBD_POP = 0
Then(1)
# Pre or post-operating phase not active
If(2) (
LV_STALL = 0
# Engine is not stalled, running or not (stop&start)
or
LC_INC_PID_1F_STALL = 1
# PID $1F may be incremented when engine is stalled
)
Then(2)
If(3) T_AST_SAE < 65535 s
Then(3)

# Maximum value not reached
# Timer shall not wrap around to 0
T_AST_SAE = T_AST_SAE + 1 s
Else(3)
# Timer shall not wrap around to 0

Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Else(1)

No treatment

35.16.7 ACTION_ERRM_StartDC
General information:
This action is called to notify (internally to ERRM aggregate) beginning of driving cycle.
Parameter PRM_DC_TYP is used t indicate the context of the call:
- Parameter ?NOMINAL? (value 0H) is used to indicate ACTION_ERRM_StartDC is called in the context of new
driving cycle triggered by driver (using ignition key or start button).
- Parameter ?AFTER_CLR? (value 1H) is used to indicate ACTION_ERRM_StartDC is called in the context of new
driving cycle triggered by a global ERRM clearing request (e.g. Mode $04, OEM clearing by tester).
"Driving cycle on CAN" is reset in case of new OBD driving cycle : LV_DC_CAN is set to 0 until OBD driving cycle
is quali?ed.
OBD driving cycle has to be quali?ed due to new driving cycle : LV_OBD_QLD and T_OBD_QLD are reset.
PRM_DC_TYP is used for call of ACTION_ERRM_SetDC.
This action also triggers NOx module regarding new DC start.
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: -
Activation: At Action call
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
# Warm-up cycle detection is reset and ready for a new detection
STATE_DC_WUP = 0H
T_AST_WUP = 0 s
T_VS_WUP = 0 s
LV_WUP_CYC = 0
LV_STATE_WUP = 0
# Time elapsed since beginning of driving cycle is reset
T_DC = 0 s
# New driving cycle notification
ACTION_ERRM_SetDC(PRM_DC_TYP)
If(1a) CTR_DC_OBD < 65535
Then(1a)
# Driving cycle counter may be incremented
CTR_DC_OBD = CTR_DC_OBD + 1
Else(1a)
# Driving cycle counter is saturated to its maximum value
CTR_DC_OBD = 65535
Endif(1a)
# Rest of "Driving Cycle on CAN" information
LV_DC_CAN = 0
# OBD start has to be done

35.16.10 ACTION_ERRM_TrigDcOnClr
General information:
If permitted by the OEM-speci?c requirements, the fault memory can be deleted with ignition on and engine
running by the manufacturer speci?c testers or the generic scan tool. Diagnostic functions have to be reinitial-
ized immediately after the start of the new driving cycle triggered by the deletion of the fault memory. If the
vehicle is in a critical mode (fail safe, limp home) and the reinitialization could cause a damage to the car, the
reinitialization must be inhibited.
This action is called to force a new driving cycle after a global ERRM clearing request (e.g. Mode $04, OEM
clearing by tester).The new driving cycle may be triggered only if LC_DC_CLR_FMY_ENA is set to 1 and com-
bustion engine / electric motor are running or current driving cycle is quali?ed, else ERRM clearing request is
without impact on driving cycle and then current driving cycle is continued.
OBD driving cycle has to be quali?ed again in case of new driving cycle (LV_OBD_QLD and T_OBD_QLD reset
in ACTION_ERRM_StartDC).
Reset of T_OBD_QLD in case of global ERRM clearing request consists in restarting timing condition when
current OBD driving cycle is not quali?ed. With LC_DC_CLR_FMY_ENA = 0, reset of T_OBD_QLD has no effect if
OBD driving cycle has already been quali?ed.
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: -
Activation: At Action call
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
If(1) LC_DC_CLR_FMY_ENA = 1
# Strategy to force a new driving cycle after ERRM clearing enabled
and
(
LV_OBD_QLD = 1
# OBD driving cycle qualified
or
LV_OBD_ES = 0
# Combustion engine / electric motor engine are running
)
Then(1)
# New driving cycle may be triggered
ACTION_ERRM_EndDC()
ACTION_ERRM_StartDC(?AFTER_CLR?)
Else(1)
# New driving cycle shall not be triggered
# Strategy is not enabled or
# OBD driving cycle not qualified and OBD not started
# Reset of time elapsed since OBD start
# until OBD driving cycle is qualified
T_OBD_QLD = 0
Endif(1)

� General Information
This speci?cation describes the driving cycle management and all related project speci?c treatments related
to driving cycle.
35.17.1 Interface to adapt several type of vehicle: hybrid, stop&start or conventional ve-
hicle
� General Information
To cover several type of vehicles: hybrid, stop&start or conventional vehicle, the error management function
needs some system parameters in order to compute driving cycle detection.
- The driver intention request (the driver intends to drive the car)
- Combustion engine has started or is stopped
- Combustion engine speed
- The electrical machine has started or is stopped
- The electrical machine speed
- Post-operating phase de?nition
- etc ...
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event
LV_OBD_ES = 0
LV_OBD_POP = 1
At NVMINI system event
LV_OBD_ST_MEM = 0
At NVMRES system event
LV_OBD_ST_MEM is restored from NVMY
Activation: Always
Deactivation: Never
Recurrence: 10 ms

� Function Description
This section may be used by projects
Engine stopped condition definition
Project shall specify here when both hybrid electric motor and
combustion engine are stopped
If(1) N <= C_N_ES_THD_OBD # Combustion engine stopped
and
|N_EM| <= C_N_EM_THD_OBD # Electric machine speed stopped
Then(1)
# Both hybrid electric machine and combustion engine are stopped
LV_OBD_ES = 1
Else(1)
# At least hybrid electric machine or combustion engine is running
LV_OBD_ES = 0
Endif(1)
?Ready for driving? information definition
Project shall specify here the vehicle status which allows the
driver to move the vehicle instantly by pushing the gas pedal.
Important notes:
- ?Ready for driving? information shall be used with electric and
hybrid vehicles (e.g. CAN information coming from hybrid control
unit).
- For conventional vehicles equipped a combustion engine LV_READY_
DRIV is always set to 0.
LV_READY_DRIV = 0
Pre or post-operating phase definition
Pre or post-operating phase corresponds to pre-run phase
(e.g. pre-drive, wake-up) or after-run phase (e.g. power-latch
phase).
Because ECU states may depend on vehicle architecture and
complexity, it is often possible that post-operating phase is ended
to activate for a while the wake-up state (i.e. driver opening
doors or approaching the car). From such state, ECU states manager
may switch to operating states (ignition key turned on and vehicle
driven) or toward post-operating phase again (i.e. vehicle woken-up
but driver did not turn on ignition key to drive).
From OBD point of view, the post-operating phase is defined as the
phase where ignition key if turned off with engine or electric motor
stopped. Such state could correspond to some wake-up state.
Project shall specify here conditions corresponding to this phase;
e.g. IF ignition key is off AND both hybrid electric machine and
combustion engine are stopped.
If(2) LV_IGK = 0 # Ignition key is off
and
LV_OBD_ES = 1 # Both hybrid electric machine and combustion
# engine are stopped
Then(2)
LV_OBD_POP = 1
Else(2)
LV_OBD_POP = 0
Endif(2)

� Function Description
This section may be used by projects
Coolant temperature adaptation
Data types between diesel and gasoline system may be different.
Therefore, coolant temperature may be be adapted hereafter if
necessary.
TCO_OBD = TCO
Ambient temperature adaptation
Data types between diesel and gasoline system may be different.
Therefore, ambient temperature may be be adapted hereafter if
necessary. Also, ambient temperature provided by a model may be
used.
TAM_OBD = TAA_SAE
