� General Information
Note:
The link between the failure stored in the dynamic error management at position IDX_DYN and the freeze
frame of this failure is made with IDX_FRF[IDX_DYN]. E. g. a failure stored at the position IDX_DYN = 2 belongs
to freeze frame ENVD_[m]_... with m = IDX_FRF[2].
For m the following values are possible, if the freeze frame is used: m = 1 ... NC_NR_ERR_DYN
Remark:
If one part of the freeze frame is not used, the corresponding con?guration is set to 0 (NC_NR_ENVD_OBD, NC_
NR_ENVD_CUS_CMN, NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_CMN, NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC, NC_NR_ENVD_PREV). The cor-
responding data (including calibration) are not de?ned in this case and corresponding formula is not exe-
cuted.
This module describes the structure of the freeze frame and manages the storage and deleting of the freeze
frame.
A freeze frame is a group of environmental data stored when a failure occurs.
Freeze frame is ?lled up with variables, which should not be limp home values (required by legislation for the
OBD freeze frame)
A freeze frame is made of many parts :
? ENVD_OBD: Environmental data, which are common to all failures and stored on time. It?s only updated,
if the failure has disappeared before and occurs again.
The content is de?ned by law. It?s called usually CARB Freeze Frame and the content is according to
ISO 15031-5/SAE J1979.
Size of this part is de?ned by con?guration data NC_NR_ENVD_OBD affected value is in the ERRM
con?guration data module.
Contents of this part is ?xed and de?ned in Environmental data (Appl. Inc.) module.
? ENVD_CUS_CMN : Environmental data, which are common to all failure.
The content is not required by law.
Size of this part is de?ned by con?guration data NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_CMN affected value is in ERRM
con?guration data module.
Contents of this part is ?xed and de?ned in the Environmental data (Appl. Inc.) module.
? ENVD_CUS_SET_CMN : Environmental data, which are common to all failure and stored many times. The
content is not required by law. For each failure occurrence several catches (called sets) can be done.
Size of this part is de?ned by con?guration data, affected value is in the ERRM con?guration data
module:
NC_NR_FRF_SET for number of sets per freeze frame,
NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_CMN for number of common data (in bytes) in each set.
Contents of this part is ?xed and de?ned in the Environmental data (Appl. Inc.) module.

? ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC : Environmental data, which are speci?c to each failure and stored many times. The
content is not required by law. For each failure occurrence several catches (called sets) can be done.
Size of this part is de?ned by con?guration data, affected value is in ERRM con?guration data mod-

(in bytes * NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC_BYTE_LEN) in each set.
Contents of this part is de?ned by calibration, process is described in the last chapter of this mod-
ule.
Description:
1) Freeze Frame storage mechanism (with FRF synchronization state machine)
When the failure IDX gets present, the storage of a freeze frame is done in the dynamic memory by calling the
action ACTION_ERRM_StoreFrf (IDX_DYN).
If several failures occur (TCO sensor, injector 1, injector 4), a freeze frame is stored for each failure. For RAM
memory limitation, the number of freeze frame is limited to NC_NR_ERR_DYN.
Freezeframe synchronization of the different FRF parts (with FRF-Synchronisation-Statemachine).

The NC_STATE_TBL_FRF_UPD table must have been con?gured by the OBD expert matching to the project
needs. The table will be Output from the Environmental data (Appl. Inc.) module.
Three con?gurable states can have been used:
0 (hold): at the state transition the chosen FRF part will not be changed
1 (write): at the state transition the chosen FRF part will be written
2 (erase): at the state transition the chosen FRF part will be erased
Freeze frame information is available as long as the failure is not erased from the dynamic memory.
2) Pre-stored Freeze Frame functionality
Usually the content for the freeze frame is stored, when the failure is stored within the failure memory. In special
cases, when the entry of a failure within the failure memory is delayed, it?s necessary to catch the content for
the freeze frame at the same time as the failure information is available.

This could be done with ACTION_ERRM_StorePrevFrf (IDX_ERR), called by the diagnostic function at the mo-
ment when the freeze frame should be pre-stored for failure IDX_ERR. The con?guration of the pre-stored
Freeze Frame functionality is done in the Environmental data (Appl.Inc.) module by the table NC_IDX_ENVD_
PREV [NC_NR_ENVD_PREV].
3) Failure speci?c Freeze Frame data
Two options exist regarding the Failure speci?c Freeze Frame data, depending on NLC_ENA_FRF_CLAS.
3.1) Calibratable freeze frame are de?ned per each symptom NLC_ENA_FRF_CLAS = 0
The freeze frame part called ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC contains environmental data, which can be de?ned by the
calibration ID_ERR_ENVD[IDX_ERR] for each failure IDX_ERR.
Due to con?gured size type for this FRF (dependent on NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC_BYTE_LEN), related data
de?nition is provided inside Formula section.
The calibratable system of environmental data is managed via a look-up tables de?ned in the following way:
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[NC_NR_ENVD_SPC] :
Con?guration table, which describes all possible environmental data, which can be stored in a freeze frame
(speci?c part). Affected value are de?ned in Environmental data (Appl. Inc.) module.
ID_ERR_ENVD[IDX_ERR]:
Calibration, which de?nes the environmental data (maximum of NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC), which should
be stored for failure IDX_ERR.
Example:
Storage of environmental data TIA and TCO_ST in case of TCO_EL_H failure, and MAP and AMP in case of
EGR_EL_SCG failure.
The table NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[NC_NR_ENVD_SPC] shall be de?ned with the required environmental data in the
following way: for 4 data (one byte data) NC_NR_ENVD_SPC = 5,
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[0] = dummy (value 0 is stored)
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[1] = TIA (referenced by address)
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[2] = TCO_ST (referenced by address)
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[3] = MAP (referenced by address)
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[4] = AMP (referenced by address)
The calibration for each failure, to archive the required failure speci?c data storage:
ID_ERR_ENVD[TCO_EL_H] = [1, 2]
ID_ERR_ENVD[EGR_EL_SCG] = [3, 4]
with NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC = 2
(2 byte of data to be stored in ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC)

3.2) Calibratable freeze frame classes mechanism NLC_ENA_FRF_CLAS = 1
The freeze frame part called ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC contains environmental data, which are de?ned by the cali-
bration ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS[NC_NR_FRF_CLAS] for each freeze frame class.
NC_NR_FRF_CLAS de?nes the number of freeze frames classes available for each failure.
Each failure is linked by calibration to one of the NC_NR_FRF_CLAS classes available : C_ERR_FRF_CLAS[IDX_
ERR]. Several failures may be connected to the same freeze frame class.
Due to con?gured size type for this FRF (dependent on NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC_BYTE_LEN), related data
de?nition is provided inside Formula section.
The calibratable system of environmental data is managed via a look-up tables de?ned in the following way:
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[NC_NR_ENVD_SPC] :
Con?guration table, which describes all possible environmental data, which can be stored in a freeze frame
(speci?c part). Affected value are de?ned in Environmental data (Appl. Inc.) module.
ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS[C_ERR_FRF_CLAS[IDX_ERR]] : calibration, which de?nes the environmental data (max. of
NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SPC), which should be stored for failure IDX_ERR
Example:
Storage of environmental data TIA and TCO_ST in case of TCO_EL_H failure, and MAP and AMP in case of
EGR_EL_SCG failure.
The table NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[NC_NR_ENVD_SPC] shall be de?ned with the required environmental data in the
following way: for 4 data (one byte data) NC_NR_ENVD_SPC = 5,
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[0] = dummy (value 0 is stored)
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[1] = TIA (referenced by address)
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[2] = TCO_ST (referenced by address)
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[3] = MAP (referenced by address)
NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[4] = AMP (referenced by address)
The freeze frame class calibration to capture the required speci?c data :
ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS[21] = [1, 2]
ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS[22] = [3, 4]
with NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SPC = 2
(2 byte of data to be stored in ENVD_CUS_SPC)
The calibration for each failure, to archive the required failure speci?c data storage:
C_ERR_FRF_CLAS[TCO_EL_H] = 21
C_ERR_FRF_CLAS[EGR_EL_SCG] = 22

# Find the corresponding freeze frame index

(ENVD_OBD[IDX_ENVD][0],

# use first element to start erase

(ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC[IDX_ENVD][0][0],
SIZEOF(ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC[IDX_ENVD]))
Endif(#4)

# reset of the FRF synchronisation statemachine
FRF_EVENT_STATUS[PRM_IDX_DYN] = 0 (#EVE_1)
Endif(0)

35.18.3 ACTION_ERRM_StorePrevFrfInt
Description:
Pre-stored freeze frame
This API is used to store pre-stored freeze frame for failure IDX_ERR (de?ned by PRM_IDX_ERR).
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
# Pre-stored freeze frame mechanism selected : data related to
# dynamic ERRM set to default values (e.g. = 0)
PRM_LV_ENVD_PREV = 1
ACTION_ERRM_UpdateFrfData(PRM_LV_ENVD_PREV, PRM_IDX_ERR)
ACTION_ERRM_ConvertFrfData(PRM_LV_ENVD_PREV, PRM_IDX_ERR)
# With t related to failure PRM_IDX_ERR (defined in table
# NC_IDX_ENVD_PREV[NC_NR_ENVD_PREV] see Environmental data
# (Appl. Inc.) module))
With t = ACTION_ERRM_SearchEnvdPrev(PRM_IDX_ERR)
If NC_NR_ENVD_OBD != 0
Then
For u = 0 to (NC_NR_ENVD_OBD - 1) do
ENVD_PREV_OBD[t][u] = ENVD_CONF_OBD[u]
Endfor
Endif
If NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_CMN <> 0
Then
For u = 0 to (NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_CMN - 1) do
ENVD_PREV_CUS_CMN[t][u] = ENVD_CONF_CUS_CMN[u]
Endfor
Endif
If NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_CMN <> 0
Then
For u = 0 to (NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_CMN - 1) do
ENVD_PREV_CUS_SET_CMN[t][u] = ENVD_CONF_CUS_SET_CMN[u]
Endfor
Endif
If(1) NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC <> 0
Then(1)
For u = 0 to (NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC - 1) do
If(2a) NLC_ENA_FRF_CLAS = 0
Then(2a)
# Calibratable freeze frame classes mechanism disabled
IDX_CUS_SET_SPC = ID_ERR_ENVD[IDX_ERR][u]
Else(2a)
# Calibratable freeze frame classes mechanism enabled
IDX_CUS_SET_SPC = ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS[C_ERR_FRF_CLAS

35.18.10 ACTION_ERRM_StoreCusSetSpcFrf - Private action
Description:
Customer set speci?c freeze frame storage
This private API is used to store the set PRM_NR_SET of customer speci?c freeze frame with IDX_FRF[PRM_
IDX_DYN].
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
With IDX_ERR = DIAG_INST[PRM_IDX_DYN] and m = IDX_FRF[PRM_IDX_DYN]
If(1) NC_NR_ENVD_PREV > 0
and
PRM_IDX_FRF_PREV < NC_NR_ENVD_PREV
Then(1)
# Copying of the pre-stored CUS_SET_SPC FRF
u = 0
While(1) u <NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC
ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC[m][PRM_NR_SET][u] = ENVD_PREV_CUS_SET_SPC[PRM_IDX_
FRF_PREV][u]
u = u + 1
Endwhile(1)
Else(1)
u = 0
While(2) u <NC_NR_ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC
If(2a) NLC_ENA_FRF_CLAS = 0
Then(2a)
# Calibratable freeze frame classes mechanism disabled
IDX_CUS_SET_SPC = ID_ERR_ENVD[IDX_ERR][u]
Else(2a)
# Calibratable freeze frame classes mechanism enabled
IDX_CUS_SET_SPC = ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS[C_ERR_FRF_CLAS
[IDX_ERR]][u]
Endif(2a)
If(2b) (IDX_CUS_SET_SPC >= NC_NR_ENVD_SPC)
Then(2b)
IDX_CUS_SET_SPC = 0 #default value storage
Endif(2b)
# Copy the actual environmental data value to the CUS-SET-SPC
# freeze frame
ENVD_CUS_SET_SPC[m][PRM_NR_SET][u] =
VALUE(NC_IDX_ENVD_SPC[IDX_CUS_SET_SPC])
u = u + 1
Endwhile(2)
Endif(2)

35.18.12 ACTION_ERRM_SearchEnvdPrev - Private action
Description:
Freeze frame storage
This API is used to search the index of the corresponding pre-stored freeze frame in the NC_IDX_ENVD_PREV
table.

Activation: -
Deactivation: -

Else(1)
IDX++
EndIf(1)
EndWhile(1)

For each project, it is possible to adjust the calibratable freeze frame names displayed on the calibration tool.
Several calibration options are offered to user:
- Displayed names can continuously follow the indexes values : ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS_0 ... ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS_
(n-1) with n = NC_NR_FRF_CLAS
- Displayed names can also be distinct without any relationship to indexes values : ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS_OEM_0,
ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS_OEM_1, ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS_CUSTOMER_1, ID_ERR_ENVD_CLAS_CUSTOMER_2
Rule:
Each displayed name must be unique.
The number of freeze frame classes de?ned by NC_NR_FRF_CLAS will be automatically computed based on
the number of displayed name de?ned in the third column of the table hereafter.

C_ERR_FRF_CLAS calibration is used to link a diagnostic to a freeze frame class.
To ease the calibration work, the displaying of C_ERR_FRF_CLAS value of each diagnostic will be based on
names de?ned in the third column of the table and not on the freeze frame class index. Use shall select the
freeze frame class associated to diagnostic into the list of displayed names.
Example : C_ERR_FRF_CLAS[TCO_EL_H] = CLAS_115
C_ERR_FRF_CLAS[TCO_EL_L] = CLAS_115
Both symptoms TCO_EL_H and TCO_EL_L use the same freeze frame class.
#Endif
Hint:
For the variable with 1 byte format, the high byte of this element of the table will be ful?lled with 0 (in case of
word con?guration).
35.19.1.2 Con?guration of the Freeze Frame UPDchronization state machine
With the NC_STATE_TBL_FRF_UPD[][] it is possible to synchronize the Freeze Frame
parts of (OBD, CMN, SET-CMN-X and SET-SPC-X) over different Freeze Frame occurrences.

PRM_DTC_CONF:
Identi?er to de?ne DTC type:
(0) 2 bytes SAE DTC: C_ERR_DTC_OBD

(2) 3 bytes SAE DTC: C_ERR_DTC_OBD & C_ERR_DTC_INFO
(3) 3 bytes CUS DTC: C_ERR_DTC_CUS & C_ERR_DTC_INFO
(4-FFh) reserved for future usage
PRM_FRF_DATA_CONF:
Con?guration of ENVD output-stream
0 bit: enable variable data length in outputstream
1 bit: remove dummy values from the outputstream
2 bit: add the data length information to the outputstream
3 bit: add the DID to the outputstream
4-7 bit: reserved

� General Information
EOBD/CARB of?cial requirements include a list of statistical data related to Error Management.
These statistical data are counters and timers related to Error Management events. The following speci?cation
describes all these requirements.
35.20.1 Time since diagnostic trouble codes cleared - PID $4E (J1979)
� General Information
Description:
Purpose of this strategy is to compute the time accumulated by the vehicle since diagnostic trouble codes
were cleared (via external test equipment or possibly a battery disconnect) (referenced in ISO 15031 as PID
$4E). It is simply an indication for I/M (Inspection/Maintenance), of the last time an external test equipment
was used to clear DTCs.
The engine run time since DTCs cleared shall saturate to 65535 and must not wrap to 0.
Engine stalling
A calibratable option exists that enable/disable counting during engine stalled state.
With LC_INC_PID_4E_STALL = 1, PID $4E may be incremented when engine is stalled.

Statistical
data at Error Management reset"
Activation: LV_OBD_QLD = 1
and
LV_OBD_POP = 0
and
(LV_STALL = 0 or LC_INC_PID_4E_STALL = 1)

35.20.3 Distance counters since MIL activation PID $21 and Minutes run by the engine
with MIL activated PID $4D
� General Information
Note:
In case of NLC_MIL_STAT_EXT_REQ = 0, CTR_ACT_MIL_EXT[NC_NR_ECU_EXT_MIL_REQ] and C_CTR_MAX_WUP_
EXT[NC_NR_ECU_EXT_MIL_REQ] are not de?ned and not updated.
Description:
According to ISO/DIS 15031-5.8 (Road vehicles ? Communication between vehicle and external equipment for
emissions-related diagnostics ? Part 5: Emissions-related diagnostic services), ECU must be able to indicate :
? the distance traveled while the MIL is activated
? the number of minutes run by the engine while MIL is activated
? Data may be reported for the vehicle by a single ECU or may be reported by each ECU that activates
the MIL
The purpose is to compute the covered distance and engine run time while the MIL is illuminated (MIL blinking
is considered as a MIL illumination). The mileage (DIST_ACT_MIL_SAE) and the engine run time (T_ACT_MIL_
SAE) are global information:
? which is not linked with any failure and is independent from the Pre-drive check
? which is dependent from the global MIL inhibition
? which is optionally dependent of the MIL request from external control units
? which is readable with Scan-Tool
? PID $ 21: ?distance traveled while MIL is activated? with kilometer as unit
? PID $ 4D: ?engine run time while MIL is activated? with minute as unit
Distance Traveled While MIL is activated (Service $01 PID $21)
Conditions for ?Distance traveled? counter :
? reset to 0 when MIL state changes from deactivated to activated
? accumulate counts in km if MIL is activated (ON or blinking)
? do not change value while MIL is not activated (OFF)
? reset to 0 if diagnostic information is cleared either by service $04 or at least 40 warm-up cycles without
MIL activated
? do not wrap to 0 if value is FFFFh
Minutes run by the engine while MIL activated (Service $01 PID $4D)
Conditions for ?Minutes run by the engine while MIL activated? counter :
? reset to 0 when MIL state changes from deactivated to activated
? accumulate counts in minutes if MIL is activated (ON or blinking)
? do not change value while MIL is not activated (OFF)
? reset to 0 if diagnostic information is cleared either by Service $04 or at least 40 warm-up cycles without
MIL activated
? do not wrap to $0000 if value is FFFFh

a MIL relevant failure is erased from the ERRM.

MIL request

35.20.7 ACTION_ERRM_ClcMilActReqClr(OUT <PRM_LV_MIL_REQ_EXT_CLR>) - private
Description:
Check erasement possibility of PID $21 / $4D at end of warm-up cycle in case of external MIL request without
erasement feedback.
Parameter Type Hex.Limits Phys.Limits Resol. Unit
PRM_LV_MIL_REQ_EXT_CLR OUT 0...1H 0...1 1 [-]
PID $21 / $4D erasement is allowed by external MIL request without feedback message
PRM_LV_MIL_REQ_EXT_CLR = 0: erasement not allowed
PRM_LV_MIL_REQ_EXT_CLR = 1: erasement allowed

ERRM, Statistical data (Appl. Inc.)
EOBD/CARB regulation and ISO standards requirements includes a list of statistical data related to error man-
agement. These statistical data are counters and timers related to error management events. You can ?nd
below in following chapters a description of all these requirements.
35.21.1 Erasement feedback from external control unit for PID $21 / $4D
� General Information
If ECU shall calculate the MIL statistics (PID $21 and PID $4D) for the whole vehicle, then ECU also needs the
information about the external MIL requests from all other OBD relevant control units.
The data shall be erased, when there is no more request from any relevant control unit and all previously
requesting failures are erased; i.e. they are no more accessible by service $03.
As typically not all external control units are able to provide this feedback, a distinction between two classes of
control units is necessary, and there relevance is taken into account by means of con?guration data:
- NLC_MIL_STAT_EXT_REQ de?nes if control units without feedback are considered for
PID $21/$4D and NC_NR_ECU_EXT_MIL_REQ de?nes their number.
- NLC_MIL_STAT_EXT_REQ_FB de?nes if control units with feedback are considered for
PID $21/$4D and NC_NR_ECU_EXT_MIL_REQ_FB de?nes their number.
MIL request information of both external control unit groups is pairwise gathered in module ?lamp manage-
ment appl. incidences?.
For the control units which support the feedback feature, this project speci?c information must be linked to
the variable LF_MIL_REQ_EXT_FB_CLR in this module.
The bit structure is de?ned like this:
LF_MIL_REQ_EXT_FB_CLR.bit 0 - - >control unit with feedback #0
LF_MIL_REQ_EXT_FB_CLR.bit 1 - - >control unit with feedback #1
....
LF_MIL_REQ_EXT_FB_CLR.bit 7 - - >control unit with feedback #7
The indices are limited to NC_NR_ECU_EXT_MIL_REQ_FB ? 1.
An active bit indicates that this control unit has stored no more relevant failures; i.e. gives its ?OK? for clearing of
data.
Project must take care that the provided information is reliable (e.g. no bit ?ips due to insuf?cient or wrong
initialization).
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event
If NLC_MIL_STAT_EXT_REQ_FB = 1
Then
For j = 0 to j <= NC_NR_ECU_EXT_MIL_REQ_FB - 1
LF_MIL_REQ_EXT_FB_CLR.bit j = 0
EndFor
Else
LF_MIL_REQ_EXT_FB_CLR = 0
Endif
Activation: -

35.21.2 Distance computation for ERRM
� General Information
DIST_OBD is used as input data of ERRM and should be provided by VHMD aggregate. For compatibility
reasons, this data is provided hereafter based on DIST variable.
DIST_OBD shall be resistant to reprogramming to prevent corruption of some data based on mileage consec-
utively to a reprogramming (e.g. PID $31 - mileage covered since last DTCs clear).
Note: resolutions and units of DIST and DIST_OBD could be different.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At first ECU power-up
DIST_OBD = 0
At NVMINI system event
DIST_OBD is resistant and shall not be erased (e.g reprogramming)
DIST_OBD value is restored
Recurrence: 100 ms
� Function Description
# Warning : Data type must be adapted if needed
DIST_OBD = DIST

35.21.4 ACTION_ERRM_MonitorEnableStatus
Description:
This action is used to compute the monitor enable status for the current driving cycle.
A mechanism is de?ned in the Statistical data module to avoid a toggling of the monitor enable status between
disable and enable. If the disable status is set, it stays disable till the end of the driving cycle.
The consideration of supported groups is done also in the Statistical data module.

Recurrence: -

Deactivation: -

General information:
Rate-based monitoring (RBM) and in-use performance monitoring ratio (IUPR or IUMPR) refer to same
functionality,
To gain more information about the monitoring performance under real world conditions, CARB required to
implement software algorithms to track and report in-use performance for the following monitors in a stan-
dardized format:
Gasoline system
Catalyst, Primary oxygen sensor, Evaporating system, EGR system, VVT system, Secondary air system, and
Secondary oxygen sensor.
Diesel system
NMHC catalyst, NOx reduction catalyst, NOx adsborber Particulate matter ?lter, Exhaust gas sensor, EGR sys-
tem, VVT system, Boost pressure control, Fuel system.
For both systems, a private group is provided, in order to make possible the connecting of any monitor with
rate-based monitoring, but without taking into account its result within Mode $09. Such feature is provided so
as to make possible in-use performance evaluation of any monitor.
For this kind of statistic different counters are necessary:
- Ignition cycle counter
Counter that indicates the number of ignition cycles a vehicle has experienced
- General denominator
Measures the number of times a vehicle is operated under standardized conditions
- Monitor individual numerator
Measures the number of driving cycles in which the monitor was done
- Monitor individual denominator
Counter that indicates the number of times a vehicle is operated under monitor individual
conditions.
All these counters are set to zero only when a non-volatile memory reset occurs (e.g. reprogramming). They
will not be initialized with zero on any other circumstances including when a scan-tool command to clear fault
codes is received.
35.22.1 Centralized calculation of interface for diagnostics with Rate-Based Monitoring
� General Information
This module realizes automatically the interface of diagnostics to in-use performance ratio calculation. Diag-
nostics having and already de?ned interface to compute individual numerators and denominators are not
handled by this algorithm.

ERRM, Rate based monitoring
Each diagnostic connected to Rate-Based Monitoring functionality has an identi?er de?ned with an index value
(NC_IDX_RBM_XX constant). Refer to Table of failures NC_IDX_TBL_DIAG_RBM[NC_NR_DIAG_RBM].
This algorithm is able to manage computations for diagnostics with indexes values in the range [1...NC_NR_
DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM].
Among these diagnostics, some of them are connected and declared by con?guration mean : indexes values
in the range [1...NC_NR_DIAG_NOT_CAL_RBM]. Others may be connected and declared, after SW compilation,
by calibration : [1...NC_NR_DIAG_CAL_RBM].
Diagnostics having a speci?c interface to request numerators / denominators computations are not taken into
account by the centralized algorithm. Theirs indexes are in the range [NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM+1...NC_
NR_DIAG_RBM], where NC_NR_DIAG_RBM is the total number of diagnostics connected to rate-based monitor-
ing.
To connect any diagnostic with the calibratable option to rate-based monitoring, it is required to adjust C_IDX_
ERR_RBM[ ] to the desired diagnostic index (e.g C_IDX_ERR_RBM[0] = TCE_PLAUS)
As regard application tool (INCA,...), related data (numerator and denominator) are handled by value and not
by string.
Example:
When connecting TCE_PLAUS diagnostic, C_IDX_ERR_RBM[RBM_CAL_0] = ?TCE_PLAUS? and numerator/denominator
shall be read out with CTR_COMP_RBM[RBM_CAL_0] and CTR_CDN_RBM[RBM_CAL_0]. FARM inhibition index
will be selected among the list of all existing FIDs within the whole system using
C_CAL_FID_RBM[RBM_CAL_0].
Finally, it is possible to connect by calibration one diagnostic which would already be connected by mean of
con?guration. In this case, two numerators/denominators will be de?ned for the same diagnostic index.
Important notes:
Diagnostics for which ?Conditions met long enough to detect malfunction? is not covered by ACTION_ERRM_
GetEndDiag shall not be managed by this central algorithm.
Diagnostics with additional conditions may be managed by this central algorithm.
Diagnostics individual conditions may be computed as follow :
? C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM].bit 7=0 : central calculation of additional conditions derived from C_
ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM]
? C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM].bit 7=1 : central calculation of additional conditions derived from C_
ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM] and also from diagnostic side
Note that for diagnostics designed without additional conditions, bit 7 of C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM is pre-calibrated
by SW tooling as ready-only, whereas other bits may be calibrated. Possible range for calibration is therefore
[0...127].
Mileage criteria is calculated automatically in Rate-Based Monitoring core function, if this feature is selected for
the monitor with ?C_ERR_RBM_CLAS?. Therefore no additional calculation for bit 2 is necessary.
Output data detailed description:
STATE_RBM[NC_NR_DIAG_RBM]: information data used by centralized algorithm for computations of numer-
ator and denominator of diagnostics without any interface or using it partially (only for additional individual
conditions)
bit 0: conditions for monitoring are met long enough to detect malfunction (bit 0 = 1)
bit 1: inhibition of the monitor because of system failure(s) (bit 1 = 1)

� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event
# Centralized module is used
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
STATE_RBM[m] = 0
EndFor
Activation: NC_NR_DIAG_INT_RBM <> NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
Deactivation: NC_NR_DIAG_INT_RBM = NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
Recurrence: 1 s
� Function Description
# For all diagnostics instances listed in the Table of Failures and
# managed by the centralized algorithm
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM
# This loop operates on diagnostics connected to rate-based monitoring by
# configuration and by calibration
# Monitor disablement because of system malfunction
If(1) STATE_RBM[m].bit1 = 0
Then(1)
# Calculate according to column ?FARM identifier?
For p = 1 to NC_NR_FID_AVL_RBM
ACTION_ERRM_GetFid(m, p, FID_RBM)
If(2a) PRM_FID <> FFFFh
Then(2a)
ACTION_FARM_GetPendingPrms(FID_RBM, LV_PRMS)
If(3) LV_PRMS = 0
Then(3)
Exit for loop
Endif(3)
Else(2a)
LV_PRMS = 1
Endif(2a)
Endfor
If(2b) LV_PRMS = 0
Then(2b)
ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor(m)
STATE_RBM[m].bit1 = 1
Else(2b)
# Conditions met long enough to detect malfunction
If(3a) STATE_RBM[m].bit0 = 0
Then(3a)
# Calculate according to column ?Diagnostic
# Instance?
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxErr(m, IDX_ERR)
ACTION_ERRM_GetEndDiag(IDX_ERR, LV_END)
If(4) LV_END = 1
Then(4)

ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(m)
STATE_RBM[m].bit0 = 1
Else(4)
# Do nothing
Endif(4)
Else(3a)
# Do nothing
Endif(3a)
# Additional monitor specific activation conditions
If(3b) STATE_RBM[m].bit2 = 0
Then(3b)
If(4) C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[m].bit7 = 0
Then(4)
# Diagnostic with additional conditions
# to increment individual denominator
# Additional conditions computation
# not calculated by diagnostic
ACTION_ERRM_GetIndCdnRbm(C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[m],
LV_IND_CDN_RBM)
If(5) LV_IND_CDN_RBM = 1

# ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor was

STATE_CTR_RBM[m].bit3 = 1

Endif(6)
Else(5)
# Do nothing

Else(4)
# Diagnostic with additional
# conditions to increment denominator
# Additional conditions computed by both
# diagnostic and centralized function based
# on calibration C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[m]
ACTION_ERRM_GetIndCdnRbm(C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[m],
LV_IND_CDN_RBM)
If(5) LV_IND_CDN_RBM = 1
and
STATE_RBM[m].bit3 = 1
Then(5)
# STATE_RBM[m].bit3 = 1 was set by
# diagnostic call to
# ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor
# when individual conditions managed
# by it were fulfilled.
# Monitor individual denominator may
# be incremented
STATE_CTR_RBM[m].bit3 = 1
STATE_RBM[m].bit2 = 1
Else(5)
# Do nothing
Endif(5)
Endif(4)
Else(3b)
# Do nothing
Endif(3b)
Endif(2b)
Else(1)
# Do nothing

with interface (bit 1 and bit 2)
� General Information
This algorithm is executed automatically on recurrence to compute inhibitions and additional conditions of
diagnostics designed with an interface with rate-based monitoring.
Diagnostics inhibition (bit 1)
Then, for such diagnostics, interface to increment numerators and denominators may be reduced to only two
actions :
- ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor(m) to be called when ?Conditions met long enough to detect mal-
function?
- ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor(m) to be called when speci?c additional conditions were encountered
to increment denominator.
The third action ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor(m) is no more called by diagnostic itself but by the algo-
rithm hereafter.

NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM <> NC_NR_DIAG_RBM

35.22.3 Ignition cycle counter
� General Information
Description:
The number of ignition cycles since the ?rst ECU power up are counted within CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM. The counter
is incremented each time a driving cycle is quali?ed. This value is only initialized with 0 on saved RAM lost (or
reprogramming). If CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM is incremented LV_IGK_CYC_RBM is set to 1 to indicate that counter is
already incremented within this driving cycle.
If the counter reaches its maximum value, the value is set to 0 on the next calculation.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At NVMINI system event
# First ECU power up / on saved RAM lost (or reprogramming)
CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM = 0
LV_IGK_CYC_RBM = 0
At beginning of driving cycle
# See ACTION_ERRM_ClcRbmSetDC() description
Activation: LV_IGK_CYC_RBM = 0
Deactivation: LV_IGK_CYC_RBM = 1
Recurrence: 10 ms
� Function Description
If(1) LV_OBD_QLD = 1
Then(1)
# OBD driving cycle is qualified
If(2) CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM < 65535
Then(2)
# Maximum value not reached
CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM = CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM + 1
Else(2)
# Maximum value reached : counter shall rollover
CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM = 0
Endif(2)
# CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM incremented in this driving cycle
LV_IGK_CYC_RBM = 1
Endif(1)

35.22.4 General denominator calculation
� General Information
Description:
The general denominator is de?ned as a measure of the number of times a vehicle as been operated in de?ned
conditions so that a speci?c diagnostic function could have passed.
The general denominator counter CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM is incremented each time a valid driving cycle with
standardized vehicle operation (LV_DC_RBM = 1) is recognized. The numbers of driving cycles are counted
since the ?rst ECU power-up. This value is only initialized with 0 on saved RAM lost (or reprogramming).
If the counter reaches its maximum value, the value is set to 0 on the next calculation.
The computation is ensured by private action at LV_DC_RBM 0->1 transition: ACTION_ERRM_IncGenDenRbm(
)
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At NVMINI system event
# First ECU power up / on saved RAM lost (or reprogramming)
CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM = 0
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Recurrence: -
� Function Description
# No treatment described here : refer to ACTION_ERRM_IncGenDenRbm( )
35.22.5 Monitor individual numerator calculation
� General Information
Description:
For all monitors requiring Rate-Based Monitoring a numerator must be calculated. The monitor individual
numerator shall be incremented once if the conditions for the monitor were present for a suf?cient time and
monitor was not disabled because of any system malfunction. CTR_COMP_RBM[m] numerator is incremented
only once within the driving cycle, if request to increment was received (bit 2 of STATE_CTR_RBM[m] = 1). This
value is only initialized with 0 on saved RAM lost (or reprogramming).
Case a malfunction (pending fault code logged) disables the monitor, incrementing numerator is locked until
malfunction is no longer detected (pending code is erased).
If either the individual numerator or denominator for a speci?c monitor reaches the maximum value (65535),
both numbers shall be divided by two before either is incremented again to avoid over?ow con?ict.

35.22.6 Monitor individual denominator calculation
� General Information
Description:
In comparison to the counter CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM, counting the numbers of driving cycles since the ?rst ECU
power-up, the monitor individual denominator is counting the number of DC in which special vehicle/driving
and ambient conditions are met individually for each monitor.
The counter CTR_CDN_RBM[m] is managed individually for each monitor , for which the monitoring of the real
in-use performance is made.
This denominator CTR_CDN_RBM[m] is incremented only once within the driving cycle, if request to incre-
ment was received (bit 3 of STATE_CTR_RBM[m] = 1). Case a malfunction (pending fault code logged) dis-
ables the monitor, incrementing numerator is locked until malfunction is no longer detected (pending code is
erased).This value is only initialized with 0 on saved RAM lost (or reprogramming).
To increment the monitor denominator, some common conditions must be ful?lled (LV_DC_RBM = 1) but also
monitor individual conditions. These monitor individual conditions are managed within the monitor function.
The value is only initialized with 0 on saved RAM lost (or reprogramming).
Nevertheless, for some customer speci?c monitors, standardized vehicle operation criteria might not be re-
quired, and in this case only monitor individual conditions are taken into account.

ACTION_ERRM_ClcDenominatorRbm()
35.22.7 Standardized vehicle operation for Rate-Based Monitoring
� General Information
For the calculation of the denominators for Rate-Based Monitoring, CARB standardized vehicle operations,
which must be met to increment the denominator counter.
Description:
A special driving cycle (LV_DC_RBM) for Rate-Based Monitoring is de?ned, which is set, if the following stan-
dardized vehicle operations are ful?lled:
- Cumulated trip length (time since engine start) T_AST_RBM >= C_T_AST_RBM
(CARB : 600 s)
- Cumulative vehicle operation >= C_VS_THD_RBM for minimum of C_T_VS_RBM
(CARB : >= 40 km/h (25mph) for at least 300 s)
Diesel medium duty and heavy duty engines may use cumulative vehicle operation with
calculated load >= C_LOAD_THD_RBM for minimum of C_T_LOAD_RBM
(CARB : >= 15 % for at least 300 s)
- Continuous vehicle operation in idle equal or longer than C_T_IS_RBM (accelerator pedal
released and vehicle speed less or equal than 1 mph)

� General Information
With the value LV_INH_DC_RBM the inhibition of the general denominator calculation is controlled.
Case any fault (e.g. ambient temperature sensor error, ambient pressure sensor error, pedal value determina-
tion error, vehicle speed ...) preventing evaluation of standardized vehicle operation is logged, general denomi-
nator computation is inhibited and also all numerators/denominators computations are locked.

35.22.9 Cold start conditions detection
� General Information
The individual monitor condition established for evaporative system denominator calculation (see �1968.2 -
4.3.2, section D) can be applied for other diagnoses (bit 2 calculation of STATE_RBM_xx) that require extended
monitoring evaluation (e.g. coolant or intake air rationality).
Description:
Cold start conditions are set within the driving cycle when: (see �1968.2 - 4.3.2, section D)
- Cumulative time since engine start is greater than or equal to 600 seconds while at an
ambient temperature of greater than or equal to 40 degrees Fahrenheit but less than or
equal to 95 degrees Fahrenheit
- Engine cold start occurs with engine coolant temperature at engine start greater than or
equal to 40 degrees Fahrenheit but less than or equal to 95 degrees Fahrenheit and less
than or equal to 12 degrees Fahrenheit higher than ambient temperature at engine start.
- Driving cycle is quali?ed

ERRM, Rate based monitoring
35.22.10 Mileage computation for mileage criteria
� General Information
For some monitors, 500 miles cumulative distance of vehicle operation experienced since the last time the
denominator of monitor was incremented is required. Therefore, a distance must be computed.
It is the intention of the following formula to compute DIST_RBM with a 2 bytes data type, in kilometers.
Mileage criteria is not computed in miles but converted in equivalent kilometers.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At NVMINI system event
DIST_TMP_RBM = DIST_OBD
DIST_RBM = 0 km
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
DIST_CDN_RBM[m] = 0 km
LV_DIST_DC_RBM_MEM[m] = 0
Endfor
Activation: Always
Deactivation: Never
Recurrence: 1 s
� Function Description
If(1) (DIST_OBD - DIST_TMP_RBM) >= 1000 m
Then(1)
DIST_TMP_RBM = DIST_OBD
If(2) DIST_RBM < 65535 km
Then(2)
DIST_RBM = DIST_RBM + 1
Else(2)
# Distance shall roll-over
DIST_RBM = 0 km
Endif(2)
Else(1)
# Distance covered is less than 1000 m
No treatment
Endif(1)

ERRM, Rate based monitoring
35.22.11 Reporting of rate-based monitoring data in accordance to SAE J1979 (OBD Mode
$09)
� General Information
The Rate-Based Monitoring statistics shall be reported to the Scan-Tool via the Mode $09. This chapter de-
scribes reporting of all rate-based monitoring data by the diagnostic manager.
The data to be transmitted are :
- Ignition cycle counter
- General denominator
- For each group of monitors, individual numerator and denominator of the monitor
which has the lowest In-Use Performance ratios.
These statistics are required and transmitted within Mode $09 for the monitors of the following groups:
Gasoline system Diesel system
Catalyst bank 1 NMHC catalyst
Catalyst bank 2 NOx reduction catalyst
Oxygen sensor upstream bank 1 NOx adsorber
Oxygen sensor upstream bank 2 Particulate matter ?lter
EGR system and/or VVT system Exhaust gas sensor bank 1
Secondary air system EGR system and/or VVT system
Evaporating system Boost pressure control
Oxygen sensor downstream bank 1 Fuel system
Oxygen sensor downstream bank 2
Monitors declared into the PRIVATE group are not taken into account for Mode $09 reporting.
The selection of data to be displayed on Scan-Tool shall respect some rules :
? For each group of monitors, the individual numerator and denominator of monitor which has the lowest
numerical In-Use Performance ratio shall be reported.
? If two or more speci?c monitors of the same group have identical ratios, the corresponding numerator
and denominator for the speci?c monitor that has the highest denominator shall be reported.
? Depending on system con?gurations, some components might not exist (e.g. O2 Sensor for bank 2 on
vehicles with 1 bank engine). In this case the numerator and denominator shall be set to 0.

35.22.12 Algorithm computing monitors with lowest in-use performance ratio according
to SAE J1979 (OBD Mode $09)
� General Information
The purpose of this paragraph is to describe how are calculated data to be reported through Mode $09
InfoTypes $08 and $0B in accordance to SAE J1979.
Description:
Continuously, every second, numerator and denominator of monitor with lowest ratio are calculated for one
single group, provided that at least one counter in the related group has changed.

35.22.13 ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor
General information:
APIs to be used by monitors to interface with rate-based monitoring functionality: Request to increment
monitor individual numerator
This action shall be called when individual monitor numerator may be incremented; it means when:
Conditions for monitoring were met long enough to detect malfunction
and
Monitor is not inhibited because of a system fault
and
End of line mode not activated
Formula section:
If(0) 1 <= PRM_IDX_RBM <= NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
Then(0)
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxErr(PRM_IDX_RBM, IDX_ERR)
ACTION_ERRM_GetFailureLocked (IDX_ERR, PRM_LV_LOCK)
If(1) PRM_LV_LOCK = 0
and
bit 1 of STATE_OBD_EOL = 0
Then(1)
# Monitor individual numerator may be incremented
bit 2 of STATE_CTR_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM] = 1
Else(1)
# Monitor locked by diagnostic central locking mechanism
# or monitor locked by end of line mode activation
No treatment
Endif(1)
Else(0)
No treatment
# Request rejected, index out of range
Endif(0)

35.22.14 ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor
General information:
APIs to be used by monitors to interface with rate-based monitoring functionality: Request to increment mon-
itor individual denominator.
This action shall be called when individual monitor denominator shall be incremented; it means when:
Monitor is not inhibited because of a system fault
and
Monitor individual conditions were encountered within this driving cycle
Formula section:
If(0) 1 <= PRM_IDX_RBM <= NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
Then(0)
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxErr(PRM_IDX_RBM, IDX_ERR)
ACTION_ERRM_GetFailureLocked (IDX_ERR, PRM_LV_LOCK)
If(1) PRM_LV_LOCK = 0
Then(1) # Monitor individual denominator may be incremented
STATE_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM].bit3 = 1
Else(1)
# Monitor locked by diagnostic central locking mechanism
No treatment
Endif(1)
Else(0)
No treatment
# Request rejected, index out of range
Endif(0)
35.22.15 ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor
General information:
APIs to be used by monitors to interface with rate-based monitoring functionality: Request to lock monitor
calculations.
This action shall be called as soon as the monitor is inhibited because of another system fault. In this case,
incrementing of individual numerator/denominator shall be locked.
Formula section:
If(0) 1 <= PRM_IDX_RBM <= NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
Then(0)
# Monitor individual numerator/denominator shall not be incremented
# because of a system fault that inhibit the monitor
bit 4 of STATE_CTR_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM] = 1
Else(0)
No treatment
# Request rejected, index out of range
Endif(0)

General information:
This action is called to increment the general denominator counter when LV_DC_RBM 0->1.
Formula section:
If CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM < 65535
Then
# Maximum value not reached
CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM = CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM + 1
Else

35.22.17 ACTION_ERRM_ClcNumeratorRbm - private
General information:
This action is called to perform individual numerators computations.
Formula section:
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM # all monitors requiring Rate-Based Monitoring
# See specification ?Rate-Based Monitoring (Appl. Inc.)?
If(1) bit 0 of STATE_CTR_RBM[m] = 0
# CTR_COMP_RBM[m] not yet incremented within this driving cycle
and
# Numerator/denominator calculations not locked
bit 4 of STATE_CTR_RBM[m] = 0
Then(1)
ACTION_ERRM_GetRbmClass(m,PRM_GROUP,PRM_LV_MILEAGE,
PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN)
If(2) bit 2 of STATE_CTR_RBM[m] = 1
# Monitor individual numerator may be incremented
and
PRM_GROUP < FFH
and
(LV_INH_DC_RBM = 0 or PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN = 1)
# Standardized vehicle operation detection not inhibited
# or diagnostic not using such criteria to increment
# its denominator
Then(2)
If(3) CTR_COMP_RBM[m] < 65535
Then(3)
CTR_COMP_RBM[m] = CTR_COMP_RBM[m] + 1
Else(3)
# Counter overflow treatment
# if either numerator or denominator reaches the
# maximum value 65535
# both numbers shall be divided by two
# numerator is halved and incremented
CTR_COMP_RBM[m] = (CTR_COMP_RBM[m]/2) + 1
# denominator is halved too

Endif(2)
Else(1)
# Denominator already incremented or LV_DC_RBM not set
# or numerator/denominator calculations are locked
Endif(1)
Endfor
Endif(0)

35.22.20 ACTION_ERRM_GetFid(PRM_IDX_RBM, PRM_NR_FID, PRM_FID) - private action
General information:
APIs used by rate-based monitoring functionality to get inhibition identi?er used by FARM to compute permis-
sion. Based on table of diagnostics connected to rate-based monitoring, this FID is either a con?guration either
a calibration.
Formula section:
If PRM_IDX_RBM >= 1
and
PRM_IDX_RBM <= NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
Then
If PRM_IDX_RBM < NC_NR_DIAG_NOT_CAL_RBM
or PRM_IDX_RBM >= NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM
Then
# Inhibition calculated with a configured FID
PRM_FID = NC_IDX_TBL_FID_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM, PRM_NR_FID]
Else
# Inhibition calculated with a calibratable FID
PRM_FID = C_CAL_FID_RBM[(PRM_IDX_RBM - NC_NR_DIAG_NOT_CAL_RBM),
PRM_NR_FID]
Endif
Else
# wrong index
PRM_FID = dummy farm index
Endif

General information:
APIs used by rate-based monitoring functionality to get diagnostic index. Based on table of diagnostics con-
nected to rate-based monitoring, this index is either a con?guration NC_IDX_ERR_xx either a calibration C_IDX_
ERR_xx.
Formula section:
If PRM_IDX_RBM >= 1
and
PRM_IDX_RBM <= NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
Then
If PRM_IDX_RBM < NC_NR_DIAG_NOT_CAL_RBM
or PRM_IDX_RBM >= NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM
Then
# Inhibition calculated with a configured FID
PRM_IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_TBL_DIAG_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM]
Else
# Inhibition calculated with a calibratable FID
PRM_IDX_ERR = C_IDX_ERR_RBM[(PRM_IDX_RBM - NC_NR_DIAG_NOT_CAL_RBM)]
Endif
Else
# wrong index
PRM_IDX_ERR = NO_ERROR
Endif

General information:

This action is called by the Dynamic error management core module at beginning of driving cycle. It is used
only within Rate-based monitoring functionality. Execution order of the following formula section shall be
respected.

# Inhibition of general denominator (standardized vehicle operation) reset

# paragraph

T_AST_RBM = 0 s
T_LOAD_RBM = 0 s
T_VS_RBM = 0 s
T_IS_RBM = 0 s
# Computations for Cold start conditions detection paragraph

T_AST_CST_RBM = 0 s
# Initialization for monitors Rate-Based Monitoring interface
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
STATE_RBM[m] = 0
EndFor

STATE_DC_RBM = 0H

35.22.25 ACTION_ERRM_GetDistCriteria - private action
Mileage criteria for denominator computations (for some diesel monitors): evaluation of mileage criteria;
General information:
Action to evaluate if mileage criteria is met.
Formula section:
If(0) DIST_RBM < DIST_CDN_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM]
# DIST_RBM mileage has rolled-over after having reached saturation value
# and is lower than previous mileage when denominator was incremented
Then(0)
If(1) (10000H - DIST_CDN_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM] + DIST_RBM) >= C_DIST_INC_CDN
# Mileage criteria since last time denominator was incremented met
Then(1)
PRM_LV_AUTH_DIST_RBM = 1
Else(1)
PRM_LV_AUTH_DIST_RBM = 0
Endif(1)
Else(0)
# DIST_RBM mileage is greater than has previous mileage when
# denominator was incremented
If(1) (DIST_RBM - DIST_CDN_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM]) >= C_DIST_INC_CDN
# Mileage criteria since last time denominator was incremented met
Then(1)
PRM_LV_AUTH_DIST_RBM = 1
Else(1)
PRM_LV_AUTH_DIST_RBM = 0
Endif(1)
Endif(0)
35.22.26 ACTION_ERRM_StoreDistRbm - private action
General information:
Mileage criteria for denominator computations (for some diesel monitors): storage of distance when denomi-
nator is incremented, in order to compare it to current mileage next time denominator may be incremented.
Private action to store distance when denominator is incremented for next mileage criteria evaluation.
Formula section:
# Current mileage is stored for next evaluation of mileage criteria
DIST_CDN_RBM[PRM_IDX_RBM] = DIST_RBM
If(1) NLC_OBD_DSL = 1
and
LC_DIST_DC_RBM_STGY = 1
Then(1)
# Mileage criteria strategy 1 used for diesel engine
LV_DIST_DC_RBM_MEM[PRM_IDX_RBM] = 0
Else(1)
# Gasoline engine or mileage criteria strategy 1 unused
# LV_DIST_DC_RBM_MEM[PRM_IDX_RBM] variable is defined but not used
No treatment
Endif(1)

35.22.27 ACTION_ERRM_GetIndCdnRbm
General information:
This action is used to evaluate if additional individual conditions required to increment denominator of speci?c
diagnostic were gathered or not.
STATE_IND_CDN_RBM.bit 0 to STATE_IND_CDN_RBM.bit 6 correspond to speci?c additional individual condi-
tions de?ned into the Rate-Based Monitoring (Appl. Inc.) by projects.
STATE_IND_CDN_RBM.bit 7 is reserved and not used.
For that, each bit of PRM_IND_CDN_RBM and STATE_IND_CDN_RBM are compared, excepted bit 7.
If relevant bits of PRM_IND_CDN_RBM are also set on STATE_IND_CDN_RBM, the individual conditions are gath-
ered.
Example:
For EVAP diagnostic, C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[EVAP] = x0000001b.
As soon as STATE_IND_CDN_RBM.bit 0 = 1, individual additional condition to increment denominator of this
diagnostic are gathered.
Formula section:
# When set, bit 7 of PRM_IND_CDN_RBM indicates if additional conditions
# are also computed by diagnostic itself
# bit 7 of PRM_IND_CDN_RBM shall be forced to 0 to exclude this bit
# from bitwise operation
PRM_IND_CDN_RBM.bit 7 = 0
If (PRM_IND_CDN_RBM & STATE_IND_CDN_RBM) = PRM_IND_CDN_RBM # bitwise
Then
#Individual conditions are met
PRM_LV_IND_CDN_RBM = 1
Else
#Individual conditions not yet encountered
PRM_LV_IND_CDN_RBM = 0
Endif
35.22.28 Communication interface for Mode $09
General information:
Depending on engine type, two kind of actions exist to transmit in-use performance data by mean of Mode
$09 (Scan Tool) :
ACTION_ERRM_GetMode09InfoType08 for gasoline engine
ACTION_ERRM_GetMode09InfoType0B for diesel engine
Depending on Infotype service used ($08 or $0B) the number of data to be transmitted may differ. It is
computed according to hereafter formula. It could be 20 data for a gasoline system and 18 for a diesel one.
Formula section:
NC_NR_CTR_MOD_9_RBM = NLC_OBD_DSL x NC_NR_CTR_MOD_9_TYP_0B_RBM + (1-NLC_OBD_
DSL) x NC_NR_CTR_MOD_9_TYP_08_RBM

35.22.29 ACTION_ERRM_SelectRbmByGroup - private
General information:
Rate-Based Monitoring - Communication interface: API to select RBM statistic with lowest in-use performance
ratio within one single group.
This API shall be used to determine,within one single group, the counters of the monitor which has the lowest
in-use performance ratio.
Monitors which are calibrated as not visible with any tool, are not taken into account in the following algo-
rithm.
File: 7EB04404.00A
9891Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
ERRM, Rate based monitoring
Formula section:
GROUP_REQUESTED = PRM_GROUP
m = 1
# It is primarily assumed that all denominators within group are null
LV_ALL_CTR_CDN_ZERO_RBM = 1
While m ? NC_NR_DIAG_RBM do
ACTION_ERRM_GetRbmClass(m,PRM_GROUP,PRM_LV_MILEAGE,PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN)
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxErr(m,IDX_ERR)
ACTION_ERRM_GetToolVisibility(IDX_ERR,PRM_LV_ERR_TOOL_VIS)
If(1) PRM_GROUP = GROUP_REQUESTED # Monitor belongs to group
and
PRM_GROUP < FFH # RBM group value is valid
and
PRM_LV_ERR_TOOL_VIS = 1 # Monitor is calibrated "tool visible"
Then(1)
CTR_COMP_TMP_RBM = CTR_COMP_RBM[m]
CTR_CDN_TMP_RBM = CTR_CDN_RBM[m]
IDX_TMP_RBM = m
If(2)CTR_CDN_RBM[m] <> 0000H # Denominator is different from 0
Then(2)
# Some denominators within group are non null
LV_ALL_CTR_CDN_ZERO_RBM = 0
RATIO_TMP_RBM = CTR_COMP_TMP_RBM / CTR_CDN_TMP_RBM
PRM_NUMERATOR= CTR_COMP_RBM[m]
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_CDN_RBM[m]
Else(2)
RATIO_TMP_RBM = 1FFFE000H
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_COMP_RBM[m]
PRM_DENOMINATOR = 0000H
Endif(2)
For j = (m+1) to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM do
ACTION_ERRM_GetRbmClass(j,PRM_GROUP,PRM_LV_MILEAGE,PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN)
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxErr(j,IDX_ERR)
ACTION_ERRM_GetToolVisibility(IDX_ERR,PRM_LV_ERR_TOOL_VIS)
If(3)PRM_GROUP = GROUP_REQUESTED # Monitor belongs to group
and
PRM_GROUP < FFH # RBM group value is valid
and
PRM_LV_ERR_TOOL_VIS = 1 # Monitor is calibrated "tool visible"
Then(3)
CTR_COMP_TMP_RBM = CTR_COMP_RBM[j]
CTR_CDN_TMP_RBM = CTR_CDN_RBM[j]
If(4) CTR_CDN_RBM[j] <> 0
# Denominator not null
Then(4)
# Some denominators within group are non null
LV_ALL_CTR_CDN_ZERO_RBM = 0
# Monitor with lower ratio than previous one stored
If(5) (CTR_COMP_TMP_RBM/CTR_CDN_TMP_RBM <
RATIO_TMP_RBM)
Then(5)
RATIO_TMP_RBM = CTR_COMP_TMP_RBM/CTR_CDN_TMP_RBM
IDX_TMP_RBM = j
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_COMP_RBM[j]
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_CDN_RBM[j]
Else(5)
# Case of two monitors with same ratios
If(6) CTR_COMP_TMP_RBM/CTR_CDN_TMP_RBM
= RATIO_TMP_RBM
Then(6)
File: 7EB04404.00A
9892Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
ERRM, Rate based monitoring
If(7) CTR_CDN_RBM[j] >
CTR_CDN_RBM[IDX_TMP_RBM]
Then(7)
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_COMP_RBM[j]
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_CDN_RBM[j]
IDX_TMP_RBM = j
Endif(7)
Endif(6)
Endif(5)
Else(4)
# Denominator equals 0
If(5) LV_ALL_CTR_CDN_ZERO_RBM = 1
# Till now all denominators were found null
and
# Current numerator is lower than one stored
CTR_COMP_RBM[j] ? CTR_COMP_RBM[IDX_TMP_RBM]
Then(5)
# When all denominators within group are null,
# lowest numerator shall be reported
IDX_TMP_RBM = j
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_COMP_RBM[j]
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_CDN_RBM[j]
Else(5)
# Denominator equals 0
No treatment
# If all denominators are found null then
# The first couple of data analyzed is reported
Endif(5)
Endif(4)
Else(3)
# Monitor doesn?t belong to group or group isn?t valid
Endif(3)
Endfor
m = NC_NR_DIAG_RBM + 1
# m is set to (NC_NR_DIAG_RBM + 1) so as to force a "while loop" exit
Else(1)
# Monitor with m index doesn?t belong to PRM_GROUP group
m = m + 1
PRM_NUMERATOR = 0000H
PRM_DENOMINATOR = 0000H
Endif(1)
Endwhile

35.22.30 ACTION_ERRM_GetIuprDataByDtc
General information:
This actions is called to get rate-based monitoring statistics related to a given DTC value.
It is executed in "one shot" without usage of any "Start/Continue" mechanism.
If DTC is neither valid nor found, ignition cycle counter and general denominator are reported anyway and
numerator/denominator reported data are set to 0000H.
Remarks:
- only data related to ?rst DTC found is reported.
- monitors which are calibrated as not visible with any tool, are not taken into account in the following algo-
rithm.
Formula section:
PRM_RESULT = ?NEGATIVE?
PRM_IGN_CTR = CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM
PRM_GEN_DEN = CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM
PRM_NUMERATOR = 0000H
PRM_DENOMINATOR = 0000H
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
# Table of monitors connected to Rate-Based Monitoring
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxErr(m, IDX_ERR)
If(0) IDX_ERR < NC_NR_MAX_IDX_ERR # Index is correct
Then(0)
ACTION_ERRM_GetToolVisibility(IDX_ERR,PRM_LV_ERR_TOOL_VIS)
ACTION_ERRM_GetRbmClass(m,PRM_GROUP,PRM_LV_MILEAGE,
PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN)
If(1) PRM_GROUP < FFH # RBM group value is valid
and
PRM_LV_ERR_TOOL_VIS = 1 # Monitor is "tool visible"
Then(1)
If(2) C_ERR_DTC_OBD[IDX_ERR] = PRM_DTC
Then(2)
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_COMP_RBM[m]
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_CDN_RBM[m]
PRM_RESULT = ?POSITIVE? # DTC found
Exit for loop
Else(2)
# DTC of monitor m doesn?t match with PRM_DTC
Endif(2)
Else(1)
# None diagnostic with given DTC is connected to a valid
# RBM group or DTC given doesn?t exist
Endif(1)
Endif(0)
Endfor

35.22.31 ACTION_ERRM_GetIuprDataByGroup
General information:
This action is called to get data related to monitor with lowest in-use performance into a given group.
Formula section:
PRM_IGN_CTR = CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM
PRM_GEN_DEN = CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM
If(1) NLC_OBD_DSL = 0
Then(1)
# Gasoline engine
If(2) 0H < PRM_GROUP < AH
Then(2)
x = 2*PRM_GROUP
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_MOD_9_RBM[x]
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_MOD_9_RBM[x+1]
PRM_RESULT = ?POSITIVE?
Else(2)
If(3) PRM_GROUP = FH
Then(3)
# PRIVATE group defined
ACTION_ERRM_SelectRbmByGroup (FH, CTR_COMP_RBM_TMP,
CTR_CDN_RBM_TMP)
# CTR_COMP_RBM_TMP and CTR_CDN_RBM_TMP are temporary parameters
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_COMP_RBM_TMP
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_CDN_RBM_TMP
PRM_RESULT = ?POSITIVE?
Else(3)
# PRM_GROUP group of monitors doesn?t match with a valid group
PRM_NUMERATOR = 0000H
PRM_DENOMINATOR = 0000H
PRM_RESULT = ?NEGATIVE?
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Else(1)
# Diesel engine
If(2) 0H < PRM_GROUP < 9H
Then(2)
x = 2*PRM_GROUP
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_MOD_9_RBM[x]
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_MOD_9_RBM[x+1]
PRM_RESULT = ?POSITIVE?
Else(2)
If(3) PRM_GROUP = FH
Then(3)
# PRIVATE group defined
ACTION_ERRM_SelectRbmByGroup (FH, CTR_COMP_RBM_TMP,
CTR_CDN_RBM_TMP)
# CTR_COMP_RBM_TMP and CTR_CDN_RBM_TMP are temporary parameters
PRM_NUMERATOR = CTR_COMP_RBM_TMP
PRM_DENOMINATOR = CTR_CDN_RBM_TMP
PRM_RESULT = ?POSITIVE?
Else(3)
# PRM_GROUP group of monitors doesn?t match with a valid group
PRM_NUMERATOR = 0000H
PRM_DENOMINATOR = 0000H
PRM_RESULT = ?NEGATIVE?
Endif(3)
Endif(2)
Endif(1)

35.22.32 Actions to be used to read all Rate-Based Monitoring data
General information:
ACTION_ERRM_GetNrIuprData shall be called ?rst to read
- the general denominator
- the ignition cycle counter
- the number of numerator/denominator couples (e.g. number of diagnostics connected to rate-based mon-
itoring)
Then, based on the number of numerator/denominator couples, ACTION_ERRM_GetNextIuprData shall be
called to get each couple of numerator/denominator for each diagnostic (identi?ed by DTC) with rate-based mon-
itoring.
35.22.32.1 ACTION_ERRM_GetNrIuprData
General information:
This action is called to get the number of diagnostics with Rate-Based Monitoring and belonging to a valid
Rate-Based Monitoring group :
A group is valid if the Rate-Based Monitoring class is corresponds to a legislative group or the private one.
Refer to Failure Class module to get values.
Formula section:
PRM_RESULT = ?NEGATIVE?
CTR_NR_DIAG_ENA_RBM = 0
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
ACTION_ERRM_GetIdxErr(m,IDX_ERR)
ACTION_ERRM_GetToolVisibility(IDX_ERR,PRM_LV_ERR_TOOL_VIS)
ACTION_ERRM_GetRbmClass(m,PRM_GROUP,PRM_LV_MILEAGE,PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN)
If(1) PRM_GROUP < FFH # RBM group value is valid
and
PRM_LV_ERR_TOOL_VIS = 1 # Monitor is calibrated "tool visible"
Then
CTR_NR_DIAG_ENA_RBM = CTR_NR_DIAG_ENA_RBM + 1
Endif
Endfor
PRM_IGN_CTR = CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM
PRM_GEN_DEN = CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM
PRM_NB_DIAG_RBM = CTR_NR_DIAG_ENA_RBM
PRM_RESULT = ?POSITIVE?
35.22.32.2 ACTION_ERRM_GetNextIuprData
General information:
This action is called to get all individual numerators and denominators related to DTC belonging to valid
groups.
This action is called CTR_NR_DIAG_ENA_RBM times if CTR_NR_DIAG_ENA_RBM is non null else it is not called
at all, because none diagnostics with RBM belongs to a valid OBD group.
A group is valid if the Rate-Based Monitoring class is corresponds to a legislative group or the private. Refer to
Failure Class module to get values.

35.22.33 ACTION_ERRM_ClearRbmStatistics
Communication interface: API to clear all Rate-Based Monitoring statistics
General information:
General information:
This function clears Rate-Based Monitoring statistics. Remark : For design and CPU resource reasons, this API
shall be called while engine is stopped.
Regulation text :
?Each number shall be reset to zero only when a non-volatile memory reset occurs (e.g., reprogramming event,
etc.) or, if the numbers are stored in keep-alive memory (KAM), when KAM is lost due to an interruption in
electrical power to the control module (e.g., battery disconnect, etc.). Numbers may not be reset to zero under
any other circumstances including
when a scan tool command to clear fault codes or reset KAM is received.?
The service provided in this paragraph shall be used to clear all the Rate-Based Monitoring statistics after a
reprogramming session of ECU software and/or calibration data.
This service shall not be called when a Scan Tool command to clear faults (Mode 04$) is received.
Formula section:
PRM_RES_CLR = ?NOT_CLEARED?
CTR_IGK_CYC_RBM = 0
CTR_CDN_OBD_RBM = 0
LV_INH_DC_RBM = 0
DIST_TMP_RBM = 0 m
DIST_RBM = 0 km
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM do
CTR_CDN_RBM[m] = 0
CTR_COMP_RBM[m] = 0
DIST_CDN_RBM[m] = 0 km
LV_DIST_DC_RBM_MEM[m] = 0
Endfor
For i = 0 to (NC_NR_CTR_MOD_9_RBM - 1)do
CTR_MOD_9_RBM[i] = 0000H
Endfor
PRM_RES_CLR = ?CLEARED?

35.23.1 Computation of additional conditions to increment individual denominators
� General Information
STATE_IND_CDN_RBM is used to de?ned several additional individual conditions used to increment denomina-
tors of some diagnostics.
Each bit correspond to speci?c conditions required in addition to LV_DC_RBM to increment the denominator.
The purpose of the following formula section is to de?ne and compute each speci?c condition.
STATE_IND_CDN_RBM de?nition
Bit 0 Cold start detection
? Cumulative time since engine start is greater than or equal to 600 seconds while at an ambient temperature
of greater than or equal to 40 degrees Fahrenheit but less than or equal to 95 degrees Fahrenheit.
? Engine cold start occurs with engine coolant temperature at engine start greater than or equal to 40 degrees
Fahrenheit but less than or equal to 95 degrees Fahrenheit and less than or equal to 12 degrees Fahrenheit
higher than ambient temperature at engine start.
Bit 1 speci?c CSERS conditions for VVTI AGGR
Bit 2 speci?c diagnosis conditions for VVTI AGGR
Bit 3 speci?c diagnosis conditions for VVTI AGGR
Bit 4 To be de?ned by project
Continued on next page
File: AEB04501.00J
9903Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
ERRM, Rate based monitoring (Appl. Inc.)
Bit 5 To be de?ned by project
Bit 6 To be de?ned by project
Bit 7 Reserved
For each diagnostic with in-use performance ratio calculation C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM]calibration is
used to de?ne if additional individual conditions to increment denominator are required.
? when C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM] = x0000000b, the only condition required to increment the
denominator is LV_DC_RBM = 1 (standardized vehicle operation).
? when C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM] <>x0000000b, bits set to 1 indicate which bits of STATE_IND_
CDN_RBM are required, in addition to LV_DC_RBM, to increment the denominator.
? when bit 7 of C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM] = 1, additional conditions are computed by both diagnos-
tic and hereafter algorithm.
For diagnostics connected by calibration to rate-based monitoring, this bit shall remain to 0 to disable
the diagnostic reporting.
? when bit 7 of C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[IDX_RBM] = 0, additional conditions are only computed by the here-
after algorithm. D
iagnostics computation is not required.
Note that for diagnostics designed without additional conditions, bit 7 of C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM is pre-calibrated
by SW tooling as ready-only, whereas other bits may be calibrated. Possible range for calibration is therefore
[0...127].
Important notes:
The computation of additional conditions is not available for diagnostics having a speci?c interface to request
numerators / denominators computations : C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[NC_NR_DIAG_WOUT_INT_RBM]
If additional conditions are required to increment their denominator, these conditions shall be calculated on
the diagnostic function itself, where interface to rate-based monitoring is called.
Example:
For EVAP diagnostic, C_ENA_IND_CDN_RBM[EVAP] = 00000001b means
STATE_IND_CDN_RBM.bit 0 = 1 is expected as individual additional condition to increment denominator of this
diagnostic. Bit 7 = 0 : the value of this bit can not be changed (read-only) if diagnostics has been designed
without additional conditions.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At NVMINI system event
STATE_IND_CDN_RBM = 0
Activation: Always
Deactivation: Never

35.23.4 De?nition of dummy tests monitors used for Rated-Based Monitoring valida-
tions
� General Information
In order to be able to fully test rate-based monitoring function or several dummy monitors are described
hereafter : TEST_TBL_0, TEST_TBL_1 and TEST_TBL_2.
The following formula section is intended for development conveniences (automatic testing, improve rate-
based monitoring test coverage, ...)
Interface between monitors and Rate-Based Monitoring functionality is mainly realized through
ACTION_ERRM_RbmMonitorClcFor action.
This action shall be called when:
- Conditions for monitoring are met long enough to detect malfunction (no intrusive operation, no short trip)
- Monitor disabled because of system malfunction (depending on failure status: pending)
- Monitor individual RBM conditions encountered within this driving cycle
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST system event
bit 0, bit 1 and bit 2 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_0 = 0
bit 0, bit 1 and bit 2 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_1 = 0
bit 0, bit 1 and bit 2 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_2 = 0
Activation: Always

35.23.5 Test function - report of individual ratio for a given monitor
� General Information
In the application tool you can select with C_IDX_RBM_TEST an unique index within table of monitors tracked
by Rate-Based Monitoring function. This instance is linked with the related RBM monitor identi?er (conversion
table).
NC_IDX_RBM_xx C_IDX_RBM_TEST
NC_IDX_RBM_CAT_DIAG 1
NC_IDX_RBM_FRQ_LS_UP 2
... ...
NC_IDX_RBM_OBD_LSH_UP 23
... ...
Depending on the chosen instance the corresponding numerator, denominator and ratio will be reported in
respectively COMP_RBM_TEST, CDN_RBM_TEST and RATIO_RBM_TEST.

35.23.6 ACTION_ERRM_IniRbmClcTestAbc - Private action
General information:
This action is called by ERRM aggregate to force a new evaluation of Rate-Based Monitoring data or to remove
Rate-Based Monitoring inhibition related to system fault, for TEST_TBL_0/1/2 monitors.
Formula section:
If PRM_TYP_INI = ?REST?
Then
bit 0, bit 1 and bit 2 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_0 = 0
bit 0, bit 1 and bit 2 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_1 = 0
bit 0, bit 1 and bit 2 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_2 = 0
Else
# PRM_TYP_INI = ?CLR?
bit 1 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_0 = 0
bit 1 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_1 = 0
bit 1 of STATE_RBM_TEST_TBL_2 = 0
Endif

No treatment

35.23.8.1 ACTION_ERRM_SelectRbmData
General information:
As new actions are exported by the rate-based monitoring core module, this action is provided to maintain
compatibility with OBDC 2.0.0 aggregate.
The following paragraph describes the action to be called to get in-use performance data to be transmitted via
Mode $09. All data related to InfoTypes $08 and $0B are returned on the same array.
Note:
Data related to Fuel system diesel group are not supported.

35.23.9 Actions for UDS communication - Service $22 (InUseMonitoringPerformanceRa-
tio)
The following paragraphs describe different actions to be used by UDS communication to get In Use Monitor-
ing Performance Ratio data (service $22 00 FF).
35.23.9.1 ACTION_ERRM_ResetRbmRecNr
General information:
This action is used by UDS communication to get In Use Monitoring Performance Ratio data (service $22 00
FF).
This action resets RBM_REC_NR and returns the number PRM_NR_RBM of monitors connected with rate-based
monitoring function (calibrated with a valid OBD group or the Customer one)
Application conditions:
Initialization: At RST system event
RBM_REC_NR = 0
LV_IDX_RBM_FIRST = 0
Recurrence: -
Activation: -
Formula section:
RBM_REC_NR = 0
PRM_NR_RBM = 0
LV_IDX_RBM_FIRST = 0
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
# all monitor requiring Rate-Based Monitoring
IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_TBL_DIAG_RBM[m]
ACTION_ERRM_GetFailureLocked(IDX_ERR, PRM_LV_LOCK)
ACTION_ERRM_GetRbmClass(m, PRM_GROUP, PRM_LV_MILEAGE, PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN)
If(1) PRM_GROUP < FFH
and
PRM_LV_LOCK = 0 # Monitor is not deactivated
Then(1)
PRM_NR_RBM = PRM_NR_RBM + 1
If(2) LV_IDX_RBM_FIRST = 0
Then(2)
RBM_REC_NR = m
LV_IDX_RBM_FIRST = 1
Endif(2)
Endif(1)
Endfor

35.23.9.2 ACTION_ERRM_IncrementRbmRecNr
General information:
This action increments RBM_REC_NR index of monitor connected with rate-based monitoring
Formula section:
If(0) RBM_REC_NR >= NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
Then(0)
RBM_REC_NR = 0
For m = 1 to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
# all monitor requiring Rate-Based Monitoring
IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_TBL_DIAG_RBM[m]
ACTION_ERRM_GetFailureLocked(IDX_ERR, PRM_LV_LOCK)
ACTION_ERRM_GetRbmClass(m, PRM_GROUP, PRM_LV_MILEAGE,
PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN)
If(1) PRM_GROUP < FFH
and
PRM_LV_LOCK = 0 # Monitor is not deactivated
Then(1)
RBM_REC_NR = m
Exit
Endif(1)
Endfor
Else(0)
For m = (RBM_REC_NR + 1) to NC_NR_DIAG_RBM
RBM_REC_NR = RBM_REC_NR + 1
IDX_ERR = NC_IDX_TBL_DIAG_RBM[m]
ACTION_ERRM_GetFailureLocked(IDX_ERR, PRM_LV_LOCK)
ACTION_ERRM_GetRbmClass(m, PRM_GROUP, PRM_LV_MILEAGE,
PRM_LV_WO_GEN_DEN)
If(1) PRM_GROUP < FFH
and
PRM_LV_LOCK = 0 # Monitor is not deactivated
Then(1)
Exit
Endif(1)
Endfor
Endif(0)

ACTION_ERRM_GetFailureLocked(IN <PRM_IDX_ERR>, OUT <PRM_LV_LOCK>)
� General Information
Because systems counts more and more diagnostics, to avoid multiplication of calibrations and to ease tuning
process, classes of failures de?ning diagnostic properties and behaviors are introduced.
Each class de?nes the failure type as emission relevant or not, as MIL relevant or not, as using driving cycle for
MIL illumination, and so on. It allows too to affect a readiness code group for each failure.
The con?guration of a failure is de?ned by WAL_CONF[IDX_ERR], PRI_CONF[IDX_ERR], CTR_DC_INC[IDX_ERR],
CTR_DC_DEC[IDX_ERR] and CTR_DC_MAX[IDX_ERR].
Format of WAL_CONF[IDX_ERR]
Bit Description
0 Enable WAL_1 (0 : Off / 1 : On)
See details in ?Lamp management? module.
1 Enable WAL_2 (0 : Off / 1 : On)
See details in ?Lamp management? module.
2 Enable MIL (0 : Off / 1 : On)
See details in ?Lamp management? module.
3 Enable ?ash mode for MIL (0 : Off / 1 : On)
See details in ?Lamp management? module.
4 De?nes failure as a ?CARB/EOBD failure? (emission relevant):
(failure visible via scan tool)
0 : failure is not considered as a ?CARB/EOBD failure?
1 : failure is considered as a ?CARB/EOBD failure?
5 Reserved
6 Reserved
7 Support no warm-up aging for DISA failure
0 : Warm-up aging is performed for all failures (standard behavior)
1 : DISA failure is erased without warm-up aging

35.24.1 Failure assignation
For each failure IDX_ERR, the failure class is allocated. The failure class number make this affectation, which are
the calibrations named C_ERR_CLAS[IDX_ERR] and C_ERR_CLAS_2[IDX_ERR].
This table is de?ned in the ?General Diagnostic Information?.

35.24.2 Failure class de?nition
A failure class de?nes :
Part sub-class A :
? if the failure have impact on MIL illumination or not
? if the failure have impact on MIL blinking or not
? if the failure have impact on Warning Lamp 1 or not
? if the failure have impact on Warning lamp 2 or not
? if the failure is considered as a CARB/EOBD failure (emission relevant)
(failure visible with scan tool, failure can set OBD freeze frame for Mode $02)
Part sub-class B :
? the increment value for driving cycle counter management
? the maximum value of driving cycle counter
? the decrement value for driving cycle counter management
? the priority of the failure
Part sub-class C :
? Readiness code group
? Each readiness group may be divided in two sub-groups by mean of bit 4 of most signi?cant nibble
?
? monitors having readiness status calculated using LV_READY[IDX_ERR] (appendix _CLC)
?
? monitors having readiness status considered as completed (appendix _CMPL)
Remarks:
? A con?guration exists to enable a speci?c behavior : NLC_ERR_CLAS_0_ACT
? NLC_ERR_CLAS_0_ACT = 1 and C_ERR_CLAS[IDX_ERR] = 00h : diagnostics calibrated with C_ERR_CLAS[IDX_
ERR] = 00h remain active (LV_END_DIAG[IDX_ERR], LV_ERR[IDX_ERR] and LV_READY[IDX_ERR] still con-
trolled) and fault reactions are possible. Failure entry into dynamic memory is still possible but increment
for driving cycle being set to 0, failure remains pending. Visibility of such diagnostics on generic scan
tool and customer tool is excluded. Rate-based monitoring computations are continued anyway.
? NLC_ERR_CLAS_0_ACT = 0 and C_ERR_CLAS[IDX_ERR] = 00h : failure behavior is de?ned by
sub-class A = 0 and sub-class B = 0
? Each readiness group is divided into two sub-groups indicating if readiness status of the group is cal-
culated (appendix _CLC) or set directly to completed (appendix _CMPL). Readiness status of monitors
belonging to sub-group _CMPL are not displayed on Scan Tool Mode $01.

35.24.3 Rate-based monitoring class
For each diagnostic connected to rate-based monitoring function, a calibratable group must be de?ned with
C_ERR_RBM_CLAS[IDX_RBM]. Therefore, NC_NR_DIAG_RBM calibrations are de?ned.
The 4 less signi?cant bits (less signi?cant nibble) of C_ERR_RBM_CLAS[IDX_RBM] are used to de?ne the group
of each diagnostic.
For diesel applications, the 4 most signi?cant bits (most signi?cant nibble) of C_ERR_RBM_CLAS[IDX_RBM] are
used to de?ne if diagnostic shall use the mileage criteria or not.

ERRM, Failure classes
Mileage criteria
For some monitors, 500 miles cumulative distance of vehicle operation experienced since the last time the
denominator of monitor was incremented is required. Therefore, in addition to numerators/denominators a
distance must be computed for such diagnostics requiring mileage criteria.
Notes:
- With diesel applications, rate-based monitoring class of monitors requiring the mileage criteria appliance will
be displayed on the calibration tool with the suf?x _MILEAGE :
HCCAT_MILEAGE, NCAT_MILEAGE, ..., PRIVATE_MILEAGE.
- The mileage criteria may be applied to only few monitors of the same group. If monitor A is calibrated with
C_ERR_RBM_CLAS[A] = HCCAT and monitor B is calibrated with C_ERR_RBM_CLAS[B] = HCCAT_MILEAGE, then
A and B are belonging the same group HCCAT.
General denominator conditions
For some monitors, it is possible to not use the general denominator conditions to increment the individual
denominator but only consider speci?c conditions. This feature is possible with all groups provided that bit 4
is not also set (The mileage criteria is related to general denominator conditions detection).
Notes:
- Rate-based monitoring class of monitors not requiring the general conditions to increment the individual
denominator will be displayed on the calibration tool with the suf?x _WO_GENDEN :
CAT1_WO_GENDEN, S02S1_WO_GENDEN, NCAT_WO_GENDEN, PM_WO_GENDEN,..., PRIVATE_WO_GENDEN.
- Monitors calibrated as being part of Group_WO_GENDEN will be considered for the lowest ratio computation
of the group Group.
If monitor A is calibrated with C_ERR_RBM_CLAS[A] = HCCAT and monitor B is calibrated with C_ERR_RBM_
CLAS[B] = HCCAT_WO_GENDEN, then both monitors A and B will be compared prior to be reported on the
scan tool through Mode $09 for the HCCAT group.

35.24.6 ACTION_ERRM_GetOBDRelevant
Description:
This action shall be called to detect OBD relevance of any failure.
This actions returns:
- 0 if the failure is not OBD relevant (failure not visible via scan-tool)
- 1 if the failure is OBD relevant (failure visible via scan-tool)
Application conditions:
Initialization: -
Recurrence: At Action call
Activation: -
Deactivation: -
Formula section:
PRM_LV_OBD_RLV = 0
# An OBD relevant failure means it is related to CARB/EOBD legislations
# Failure is visible with generic scan tool and failure not locked
ACTION_ERRM_GetFailureLocked(PRM_IDX_ERR, PRM_LV_LOCK)
# WAL_CONF calculated based on GetWalConf action
If(1) bit 4 of WAL_CONF[PRM_IDX_ERR] = 1 and PRM_LV_LOCK = 0
Then(1)
PRM_LV_OBD_RLV = 1
Endif(1)

� General Information
Output data detailled description:
STATE_LAMP[0] and T_PRDR_CHK[0] correspond to MIL lamp
STATE_LAMP[1] and T_PRDR_CHK[1] correspond to WAL_1 lamp
STATE_LAMP[2] and T_PRDR_CHK[2] correspond to WAL_2 lamp
Calibration data detailed description:
C_T_MIL_READY_1: Time delay between beginning of pre-drive check phase and MIL
blinking phase for readiness displaying. Shall be tuned between 15 s
and 20 s (Typical value 20 s).
C_T_MIL_READY_2 MIL blinking time duration for readiness displaying during pre-drive
check mode. Shall be tuned between 5 s and 10 s (Typical value 10 s).
LC_T_MAX_PRDR_CHK_ENA = 1: maximum time of pre-drive check duration with LV_OBD_ES = 1
is C_T_MIL_READY_1 + C_T_MIL_READY_2
= 0: pre-drive check duration with LV_OBD_ES = 1 is not limited
Con?guration data detailed description:
NC_LAMP_PRDR_CHK de?nition:
Bit 0 = 0 : pre-drive check between stalling event and engine start is disabled
Bit 0 = 1 : pre-drive check between stalling event and engine start is enabled
(Typical value: bit 0 = 0)
Bit 1 = 0 : short pre-drive check disabled in case of key transition while engine is running
Bit 1 = 1 : short pre-drive check enabled in case of key transition while engine is running

ERRM, Lamp management
(Typical value: bit 0 = 0)
Bit 2 = 0 : readiness status displaying during pre-drive check (MIL blinking) is disabled
Bit 2 = 1 : readiness status displaying during pre-drive check (MIL blinking) is enabled
(Typical value: bit 2 = 0)
General information:
With this module, it is possible to control up to three different lamps:
? MIL : Malfunction Indicator Lamp
This lamp is used to inform the vehicle driver in case of any failure which can affect emissions.
? WAL_1, WAL_2 : Warning Lamps
These lamps are used to inform the vehicle driver in case of others failures.
A task evaluates the state of each lamp. These states variables (STATE_MIL, STATE_WAL_1, STATE_WAL_2) pro-
vide exactly what has been ordered by ERRM to the lamps, based on failures status, but they don?t necessarily
indicate theirs real states.
The real physical state of each lamp (LV_MIL for MIL, LV_WAL_1 for WAL_1 and LV_WAL_2 for WAL_2) is built
depending on modes in which they are. Lamps behavior is based on three different modes:
? Lamp switched-off / Lamp inhibition
? Pre-drive check mode
? Normal mode
A state machine is based on this three different states and is fully described hereafter.
C_CONF_XXX con?guration byte (with XXX = MIL, WAL_1 or WAL_2):
Bit 0 Global lamp XXX inhibition bit
0 : lamp XXX illumination is authorized
1 : lamp XXX is never illuminated
Bit 1 Lamp XXX request enable bit
0 : lamp XXX request input is never taken into account
1 : lamp XXX request input is taken into account
Bit 2 For MIL :
Special behavior for the Mis?ring A failure in case of cylinder cut off.
0 : without management of cylinder cut off
1 : with management of cylinder cut off
For WAL_1 and WAL_2, illumination of MIL instead of lamp XXX
0 : no link between lamp XXX and MIL
1 : MIL is illuminated if illumination of lamp XXX is requested
Bit 3 Inhibition of pre-drive check for lamp XXX
0: pre-drive check for lamp XXX enabled
1: pre-drive check for lamp XXX disabled

Bit 4 For MIL, in case of management of cylinder cut off (bit 2 of C_CONF_MIL[IDX_VAR_EMI] = 1).
0: MIL is ON after the blinking MIL delay
1: MIL isn?t ON after the blinking MIL delay
Bit 5 Not Used
